He seemed most natural at using his bare hands. Throwing fire and dodging attacks rather than blocking, similar yet different than monks. Around the time of his eighth birthday, He began to suffer from nightmares. These often woke him up from phantom pain or in panic. Common themes included a giant pillar of fire, random scenes of monsters in odd places, and his own (mostly) violent deaths. Now, his father occasionally enjoyed a glass of strong liquor after a long day and Kuo was drawn to the smell of the substance. He found that sneaking and drinking it helped to ease the terrors that haunted him. While his parents were naturally furious with him, nothing kept him from the oh so wonderful healing spirits.
Over a decade and a half later, Kuo was well adapted to wandering the great plains of the Chuvashkan territory. Loved the wildlife and making friends with them. He knew where to avoid, where the best hunting spots were for food and water. He would take things back to the tribe to sell, only caring about having enough money to buy his alcohol. Until one day he was relaxing on one of his favorite hills and watching the clouds pass by, he spotted three massive looking birds flying overhead with riders. He knew they weren't dragons (he stayed away from moving past the southern border, where dragons were more common though he's never seen one). A sight he'd not seen before, but the rumors of some western adventurers did spread through the region by that point. He didn't think much of it until a few days later when the earthquakes started. The mountain in the dead walkers land had somehow, blown up (or in). He took this as a sign to follow his gut and finally leave the region. Saying goodbye to his parents, he finally began to wander where the wind took him. Ending up in the mountains above a dwarf owned city in the [[Uulan Confederacy]], he settled in a camp a mile or two outside and above the entrance. He took a number of odd jobs, made a name for himself as a heavy drinker among the dwarves, and landed a somewhat seasonal job of escorting a caravan to and from [[Rauviz]]. A year or two had passed as a regular caravan guard, and he was once again getting the itch to travel, and planned to depart after the last trip of the year. In Rauviz he met a few curious and strange individuals, got a new drinking buddy, and hoped they proved to be fun.
Spoiler alert, they did! Too bad he later found out his soul is on fire and keeps being reborn, and his nightmares involved watching the deaths of his past incarnations.
'''Appearance''': Five foot eight inches tall, in sleeveless blue shirt and flowing pants. While once was barefoot, now wears somewhat bulky looking metal boots. Wild and tangled white hair, light blue skin, and grey eyes.
'''Bonds''': His friends, the open skies, his harpy daughter Wan Chou, and fae fox Mystic
'''Ideals:''' I have a primal need to see the world. I refuse to kill anyone who can talk, regardless if they are trying to kill me or not, as nobody truly deserves to die.
'''Flaws''': Smells like both a brewery and body odor. Doesn't like to bathe much, as he wants animals to like him more if he smells natural. [[Category:Adventurers]] [[Category:Ad Elementis]]

Pyrrha and her brother, Igni, were found in the north-eastern [[Dreamwall Mountains]] by Elder Luca Kelshanne, who adopted them. They were raised by Luca and Kela Rivan-Kelshanne, their father and papa respectively. Upon reaching maturity, the two participated in the Rite of Flame, which had to do with getting the Firebird’s blessing.
In Pyrrha’s ritual, something happened to where the Firebird was gone and Igni disappeared. She’s trying to find out what happened and find Igni. Along the way, she met Eskel and grabbed him as a bodyguard/travel buddy. Eventually, she met Kuo and Yonas. She likes journalling and collecting plants/rocks/flowers to put in her journal of the places that she visits (pressing flowers). And she tries to connect to different trees (will help with Transport Via Plants) and wildlife where she goes. She wants to ‘try everything’, so she will often get into shenanigans with Kuo and Yonas. Despite her petite appearance, she is pretty strong.
'''Appearance''': 5’5 petite woman with fair skin and reddish-orange hair. Often likes to put flowers in her hair if she can find them. She wears mariner reinforced leather armor that has some blue patterns.
'''Bonds''': Friends, Igni, her dads, Wylda, elemental fox-kin Reed, and Cinder (Fire Cat)
'''Ideals''': Pyrrha wants to find her brother and help her friends, but her ideals are to try everything. Being from a sheltered background, she wants to see everything and try new things. And help people. Everyone deserves help, beast or humanoid.
'''Flaws''': She tends to enable people and avoid conflict in-party.
== Post-Campaign == Pyrrha married [[Eskel]] and has settled down as the druidic advisor to the [[Auringon]] rulers and as parent to the two odd-twins. She still maintains most of her role as the [[Firebird]]'s protective aspect. [[Category:Adventurers]] [[Category:Ad Elementis]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The head of the Red Ice [[Nocthian Caldera|Caldera]] tribal alliance and a force of about 200 mixed soldiers, along with a "superweapon" marched on [[Medvyed]] in the late sum..."
revision.text:
The head of the Red Ice [[Nocthian Caldera|Caldera]] tribal alliance and a force of about 200 mixed soldiers, along with a "superweapon" marched on [[Medvyed]] in the late summer of 251 AC, en route to [[Bedni]] to "liberate" the Industry core of the [[Deep Mind]]. They were working under the direction of the War core.
They were met at the pass through the cliffs by a force of militia, local goblin tribes, Wyrmhold engineers, and [[Half Measures]]. It went badly for them, in large part due to traps and archers. The frost giant leader was killed, the lobster-mecha "golem" was disabled, and the War core removed. This event caused the Shrikenest goblins to formally ally with Wyrmhold and the Hornet and Tuatha tribes to become much more friendly. [[Category:Battles]] [[Category:Nocthian Caldera]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A predominantly [[Jazuu]] tribe in the south-western part of the [[Nocthian Caldera]], bordering [[New Nocthia]] slightly. Relatively unique among the Caldera natives in that..."
revision.text:
A predominantly [[Jazuu]] tribe in the south-western part of the [[Nocthian Caldera]], bordering [[New Nocthia]] slightly. Relatively unique among the Caldera natives in that they are almost completely settled and agricultural, rather than pastoral or migratory. Their tribe name translates roughly (from an Oelfran Too-til dialect) to "Threefold", which matches their comparatively unique religious beliefs.
== Symbols == The Jaruud banner is a silver chevron, point up, with a black circle underneath. Usually on a blue field. The vertices of the chevron represent their three-fold "deity"; the black circle is the (unnamed normally) "Unmaker", their "evil" antagonist "deity".
== Demographics == The Jaruud are one of the more populous tribal groups, numbering about 15,000 people, of which the vast majority are Jazuu. While they have a few remnant giants, they do not worship/revere them like the Oronar do. Some of the local goblins, especially from the Fenfoot, have sought protection under the Jaruud banner.
About 1/3 the population lives in or around Jaru Tor, a town built on the (relatively well-preserved) ruins of a Nocthian city in the south-east portion of their territory. Located on a set of hilltops, the city was spared the worst of the Frost's ravages and was rebuilt during that time as a logistics center; Aela, the former administrator of the center became the first leader of the Jaruud after the fall of the Frost. Now very elderly, she is the Crone of the Three.
The Jaruud, due to their superior organization mostly, have become the fastest growing tribe in the region. Several smaller jazuu tribes to the west have already been absorbed, mostly peacefully.
== Government == The Jaruud are a theocratic matriarchy, ruled by the Three (aka the Wise) and their chosen Favorites. The Three are also the priestesses of their religion, serving as the living mouthpieces for their Threefold Voice. The Three as of 251 AC are
=== Maiden Lahmi + Warleader Hael === Lahmi and Hael handle "military". Lahmi is a 20 year old jazuu woman, standing nearly 8' tall. Renowned as a beauty, she also has a fiery temper. She loves easily, befriends easily, and gets betrayed easily. But also forgives easily. Her current Favorite is Hael, an older (40s) male--he serves as Warleader (aka guard captain/general). He prefers the spear and shield.
=== Mother Jalel + Father Ortok === Jalel and Ortok handle the vast majority of the mundane affairs of the tribe. They are the judges, the heads of civil administration, and the "cool heads" of the Three. Jalel is a woman in her 50s; Ortok is slightly younger in his late 40s. They're known to be very hard to fluster.
=== Crone Aela + Shaman Isak === Aela was once an administrator for the Frost and is in the last years of her life at nearly 110. Isak is her boy-toy at 24...but he is a competent shaman. The Crone and Shaman are the magical/spiritual core of the tribe. Aela is still quite shrewd, even if her body betrays her. Of the tribe, she is one of only a few who met [[Isskap]] in person; she is also one of the few who knows the truth about the Threefold Voice. Once she passes, Jalel will become the Crone; Lahmi the Mother, and a new Maiden will be called. The Favorites may or may not retain their current position; it's likely Isak and Ortok will, but Hael likely will not.
== Religion == The Jaruud worship the Threefold Voice, a "three in one" Ascendant (or Ascendants)? Not much is known about them by scholars; there are no records from anyone but the Jaruud...and the Jaruud are not very forthcoming. The only thing known about them is that their residence is elemental, not astral. They have strongest connections to one of the Water-aspected planes.
What is known is that they present in one of three persons--the Maiden is the fiery aspect, symbolizing youth and vigor and growth, the Mother is the earthen aspect, symbolizing stability, motherhood, and fertility, and the Crone is the water aspect, symbolizing old age, wisdom, knowledge, and magic. They have an "opponent", a being named only as Unmaker, symbolizing destruction and despair. No symbols of this latter one are presented, other than the black circle on their banner. [[Category:Nations]] [[Category:Nocthian Caldera]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The plane-bound, like the [[plane-touched]], were born of mortal parents. In fact, many of them started their lives as -touched. But unlike the their -touched kindred, they ha..."
revision.text:
The plane-bound, like the [[plane-touched]], were born of mortal parents. In fact, many of them started their lives as -touched. But unlike the their -touched kindred, they have been chosen and transformed by the [[True Word|True Words]] at the heart of their chosen plane, as wielded by the [[Named]] of those planes. Their souls, their vital Sparks are bound and molded by [[True Word|True Words]], making them a bridge between the chaotic growth of mortal-kind and the ordered stasis of the [[Named]]. They gain long life, but are not ageless. Generally, one of the -bound might live 10 or 15 times the lifespan of a normal mortal. They gain power according related to the plane to which they are bound. While they still can grow, this growth is tempered and stunted to a degree--their personalities and very essences are inexorably bound to the nature of the plane and the words.
The -bound are bound in a different way--to become -bound, you must be chosen and empowered by one of the Named, and a powerful one at that. This binds you to that Named's nature as well, and to their will to some degree. Like most things, being -bound is a double-edged sword.
The residents of the [[Shadows]] and the [[Astral]] rarely make plane-bound, but it is not unknown. There are some philosophers that believe that advanced druidic practitioners, with their vastly extended lifespans, are the nearest thing to Mortal-bound. [[Category:Races]] [[Category:Planes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Of the three types of beings (Named, Mortal, and Abhorrent), the Named are the true natives of the planes other than the Mortal, Shadow, and the Abyss. Unlike mortals, the Nam..."
revision.text:
Of the three types of beings (Named, Mortal, and Abhorrent), the Named are the true natives of the planes other than the Mortal, Shadow, and the Abyss. Unlike mortals, the Named do not have souls (or Sparks). They have, instead, [[True Word|True Words]] at their core. Or fragments thereof. Derived from the Name of their native planes, they partake of its nature. They are ageless and in some respects immortal--a Named that is destroyed will eventually reform...or one with the same name. The only ways to put them down forever include consumption by another Named (incorporating their Name into the devourer's own), consumption by an Abhorrent, artifact-grade interference, or being destroyed while present in full self on the mortal plane (and their name thus returning to its source). This strength is also a weakness--the Named can be bound by their Names and compelled to act in ways that are difficult to replicate with mortals. They are also inherently stagnant--the only way for them to change significantly is for the Word at their core to change, a process that requires consuming another Named...or personality-changing trauma. They require a steady influx of aether to sustain their existence, and their personal power changes with how much aether they can gather.
== Named of the Planes ==
* For the elemental planes, the high-ranking Named are the genies: ** Dao of the planes of Earth ** Ifriti of the planes of Fire ** Djinni of the planes of Air ** Maridi of the planes of water. * For the Astral, the named are mostly [[Lucians]]. [[Ascendant|Ascendants]] are also Named, despite having once been mortals. * Some claim that the [[Fey]] are the Named of Shadow, but really there are no Named for Shadow; the Fey are the Named of the Mortal plane.
[[Category:Races]] [[Category:Planes]] [[Category:Metaphysics]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The dominant international banking conglomerate, started by [[Helwyr]] of the [[Wild Cards]] in [[Zhapai Karmap]], with branches in every major city across the Federated Nat..."
revision.text:
The dominant international banking conglomerate, started by [[Helwyr]] of the [[Wild Cards]] in [[Zhapai Karmap]], with branches in every major city across the [[Federated Nations]] and even allied nations across Western [[Noefra]].
== Features == Members gain the following benefits:
* Safekeeping for valuables (branch specific), backed by the rabid ferocity and full might of [[Zhapai Karmap]], with other [[Registered Companies]] contracted to hunt down anyone who steals. * Full transferability/availability of funds at any branch. Significant (and closely-guarded) magical synchronization is used to enable this. * Bank notes, allowing carrying thousands of [[Coinage|gold council marks]] without hundreds of pounds of coin. * Currency conversion (available as a free service for adventurers). * Appraisal and brokerage services (free for account holders with significant daily balances, although nominal fees may be charged for particularly dangerous items). * Notary public and message services at a small fee. * Loans for vetted individuals. '''Note''': Adventurers, due to their low life expectancies, rarely qualify for such loans.
== Safety == Branches are built like bunkers, and outsiders do not get access beyond the outermost room, which is separated from the inside by heavy barriers. Staffed by clans of paranoid goblins who all know each other intimately, as well as magical detection and neutralization systems, there has not been a successful theft by force from a bank branch in its 35 year history. Fraud and other losses are very small.
== Branch List == The bank has branches in the following locations. Branches come in either Full or Satellite varieties--Full branches have all facilities, while Satellite branches coordinate with their parent Full branch and generally only offer "core" banking services (deposits, withdrawals, and conversion). Branches listed are full branches unless specified otherwise. Generally, cities with multiple branches will have 1 full branch and several satellite branches.
* Giant-spine Mountains ** Bolor Hold (1 full) ** Kozhuyn (1 full) ** [[Zhapai Karmap]] (multiple) ** [[Shinevog]] * Crisial Kingdom: ** [[Crisial City]] (multiple) ** [[Egoriden]] ** [[Ineg'and]] ** [[Honel]] * [[Rauviz City]] (multiple) * Duarchy ** [[Godsfall]] (multiple) ** [[Baile Craan]] ** [[Rabbiton]] ** [[Bradford]] ** [[Honedaxe]] (satellite) * [[Kaelthia]] '''NB''': in the changes post [[Winter War]], this branch is now closed. * [[Fuar Uulan]] (multiple) * Wyrmhold ** [[Lyodnoir]] (multiple) ** [[Baile Duchas]] ** [[Byarsha]] * Byssia ** [[Byss]] (multiple) ** [[Delphni]] ** [[Terasopis]] (satellite) * Jungle of Fangs: ** Asai'ka (multiple) ** Sha'slar (1 satellite) ** Kel'al'ar ** Tarad'am (1 full)
[[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The basic calendar used across [[Noefra]] was developed by the old western empire, [[Tibor Imperia]] and standardized during the first year of the Biblia Dynasty, 1286 BC. The..."
revision.text:
The basic calendar used across [[Noefra]] was developed by the old western empire, [[Tibor Imperia]] and standardized during the first year of the Biblia Dynasty, 1286 BC. The "year zero" was reset at the [[Cataclysm]], dividing the years into BC (Before Cataclysm) and AC (After Cataclysm). The result is the Reformed Imperial Calendar. Other regionally-used calendars are mentioned below. This wiki uses Reformed Imperial measures across the board for all dates.
== Years, Seasons, Months, and Weeks. == Each year is a single orbit of [[Quartus]] around [[Eua]], which has a period of 384 days, exactly. The year is divided into 12 months of 32 days, each one matching a complete cycle of [[Quella]], the larger red moon. Three months form a season. Each month is divided into 4 8-day weeks, each matching the complete cycle of [[Teki]], the white moon. There are no calendar adjustments like leap years.
The year begins with 1 Spring Dawning and ends with 32 Winter Dying. Thus, the months roughly correspond to March - February in order, although their lengths are different from Earth months. Each month corresponds to the peak influence of an elemental plane. {| class="wikitable" |+Months and Seasons !Month !Season !Element !Earth Equivalent |- |Spring Dawning |Spring |Clay |March |- |Rebirth |Spring |Stone |April |- |Spring Dying |Spring |Coal |May |- |Summer Dawning |Summer |Lava |June |- |High Summer |Summer |Flame |July |- |Summer Dying |Summer |Lightning |August |- |Autumn Dawning |Autumn |Smoke |September |- |High Harvest |Autumn |Wind |October |- |Autumn Dying |Autumn |Cloud |November |- |Winter Dawning |Winter |Ice |December |- |Silence |Winter |Ocean |January |- |Winter Dying |Winter |Mud |February |} Weekdays are simply the ordinal day number, followed by Day: First-day, Second-day, Third-day, Fourth-day, Fifth-day, Sixth-day, Seventh-day, and Eighth-Day. Generally, 4th and 8th are "holy days" in many religious traditions.
== Days, Hours, Minutes, Seconds == Each day is 24.00 hours long. No leap seconds. Each hour has 60 minutes and each minute has 60 seconds, just like Earth. For practical purposes, 1 Quartus second == 1 Earth second.
== Other Calendars == Worldwide, most calendars agree on the division into months (although some use fewer seasons, such as the tribal calendars of the equatorial [[Great Rift]], which only recognize Dry and Wet). The traditional [[Byss|Byssian]] calendar simply uses the element names, but otherwise agrees. The largest variations are in
* Month names * Day names * Year Zero--non-Noefran calendars rarely use the Cataclysm as the zero point due to the much lighter effects of that event outside the Noefran continent. For example, the [[Ikela|Ikelan]] calendar reckons in years CE (Current Era) or BCE, where 1 BCE is roughly 100 AC, dating from the fall of the dragon-tyrant [[Kozhun]].
[[Category:Player's Guide]]

Stub
A major city in [[Crisial Kingdom]]. The closest major settlement to the [[Crystal Spire]], it's located half a day off of the Coast Road linking [[Crisial City]] with [[Rauviz City]]. Populated mostly by humans and gwerin, it is a farming and lumber town. There is an unusually high density of arcana-related shops and businesses due to the closeness of the Spire. [[Category:Cities]] [[Category:Crisial Kingdom]] [[Category:Unfinished]]

revision.comment: Created page with "[This is a stub] A major city in the [[Crisial Kingdom]], located south of [[Crisial City]] about 2 days travel. At the foot of the [[Sundown Hills]], it commands the mining,..."
revision.text:
[This is a stub]
A major city in the [[Crisial Kingdom]], located south of [[Crisial City]] about 2 days travel. At the foot of the [[Sundown Hills]], it commands the mining, logging, and other general extraction industries. Heavily dwarven, although humans and halflings are not super uncommon. [[Category:Cities]] [[Category:Crisial Kingdom]] [[Category:Unfinished]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The greatest theater and concert hall in the planes. The music and drama-loving inhabitants of the [[Plane of Wind]] gather here to take in the latest acts from across the cos..."
revision.text: The greatest theater and concert hall in the planes. The music and drama-loving inhabitants of the [[Plane of Wind]] gather here to take in the latest acts from across the cosmos. Mortals can win much favor and money by wowing the crowds here. Being boring, however...is very dangerous. They don't handle boring very well. [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Plane of Wind]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A small city of about 3,000 humans and ihmisi, part of the [[Farthingale Duchy]]. Ruled by Count Peila il Koa. The area is mostly occupied by shepherds who need very little ru..."
revision.text: A small city of about 3,000 humans and ihmisi, part of the [[Farthingale Duchy]]. Ruled by Count Peila il Koa. The area is mostly occupied by shepherds who need very little ruling. Extremely rural and backward. Extremely religious and conservative. [[Category:Cities]] [[Category:Duarchy of Kotimaa]] [[Category:Unfinished]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The Pelotai are one of the tribes of the [[Great Eastern Dustlands]], occupying the lands to the west of the Dead Walker Plateau. They are pure orcs and proud of it--they cons..."
revision.text: The Pelotai are one of the tribes of the [[Great Eastern Dustlands]], occupying the lands to the west of the Dead Walker Plateau. They are pure orcs and proud of it--they consider themselves the true heirs of Gromash (he who became the [[Red Fang]]). Their lands are poor, and the Pelotai are a hard, brutal people. They do honor agreements and fight openly and honestly, although they dislike most other tribes. [[Category:Great Eastern Dustlands]] [[Category:Nations]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The ruling organization of the [[Plane of Lava]], with influence outside that plane. == Creed == # The strong give order and purpose to the lives of the weak. Strength is pr..."
revision.text:
The ruling organization of the [[Plane of Lava]], with influence outside that plane.
== Creed ==
# The strong give order and purpose to the lives of the weak. Strength is proven by challenge and combat. # The weak are protected by the strong to the degree that they obey and are shaped by the order imposed by the strong. # [[Alastor, World Judge]] is the strongest there is. Thus, he provides the ultimate order for everything. # Strength must be constantly tested and refined. The slag and dross must meet the test of the refiner's fire and be purged. # Order is virtue. All that is good is given purpose by the strong; being a cog in the machine or even a slave is honorable if you have not the strength to be more. # Disorder and waste is sin. That which is not fit for its purpose must be discarded, given to the flame to be consumed as fuel. # The role of the cult is to perform Alastor's will, to preserve His order in society. Personal ambition only is valuable if it means meeting those needs more effectively. Personality is to be suppressed as much as possible--you are replaceable cogs.
== Hierarchy ==
=== Masked Judges === At the top of the hierarchy are the Masked Judges. These entities (generally vulkate in appearance) dress in white hooded cloaks, enchanted to never get dirty. Their faces are covered by masks carved to look like a dragon's face--they never reveal their faces in public. However, the arms of the cloaks are bare, revealing arms covered in markings similar to words. These glow when the Judge is wielding his power.
The Masked speak with [[Alastor, World Judge|Alastor's]] voice, quite literally. They rarely, if ever, show any signs of personality. They are vessels of the wyrm's power, conduits for him to look out and act on the world, ways for him to be in many places at once. They are his Hands. Their word is absolute law, at least on the [[Plane of Lava]] and other places where the cult holds power.
=== Mechanist Priests === The regular priests have the title "Mechanist"--they are those that keep the great machine of society humming along smoothly and efficiently. They are all [[Plane-bound|lava-bound]], and self-effacing. The intent is that any mechanist-priest is identical to any other mechanist-priest of the same rank.
=== Lava-fist === The lava-fists are the enforcers. The bully-boys, the soldiers, the body-guards. And they are brutal. [[Category:Religion]] [[Category:Plane of Lava]]

A large volcanic island located north of [[Kotimaa]]. It rose out of the depths after the [[Cataclysm]], although there is evidence (from ruins dotting the land) that it either had previously been on the surface or had been inhabited by sea-folk who were very building-happy (unlike most).
Very little is known about the island other than it is dominated by a single giant active volcano and is awash with a surfeit of fire-aspected aether. [[File:Isle-of-fire.jpg|center|thumb|]]
A research expedition assisted by [[Ad Elementis]] in 252 AC discovered that the island is inhabited by two groups: a scattered tribal human civilization of post-cataclysm refugees, and more recently, dissident [[Khaimal]] dwarves from Hammerhead. The dwarves have enslaved most of the tribal population in service of the [[Cult of Burning Law]]. The capital of this civilization is Lavalin, a town at the foot of the volcano on the north side. Less techno-magical than the Hammerhead khaimal, they still craft and work metal and stone. Extremely austere and focused on efficiency and utility, life here is unpleasant but safe.
[[Category:Noefra]] [[Category:Geography]]

The capital and only city on [[Toryuu Island]], a large island between the northern and southern [[Oelfra]]. It exists at the sufferance of the [[Eldest (Dragon)|Eldest]], an ancient gold dragon who lairs in the super-volcano that looms over the city. By treaty, it is neutral ground for the often warring nations of the continent.
== Population Demographics == Roughly 50k, mixed [[jazuu]] and [[dwarves]], although many mixed dragon-touched individuals also reside there.
== Map == Legend: The deep red area in the north-east is the domain of the Ten Houses (with locations marked) on the slopes of the volcano, although 3 of the houses have their primary residences elsewhere. The orange sector is merchant-class, catering to the trade between the mainland nations (as hostile relations prevent that trade from happening elsewhere). Light green is the lower-class district, where the working families live, along with the slums for the down-and-out. The dark-green is the docks area. Non-dragon habitation outside the outer bounds of the city is very limited--non-dragons are not allowed more than 1 day from the outermost street except with explicit permission of the draconic ruler...who rarely gives it. Most of the food is imported. [[File:Toryuu city.webp|left|frame]]
== Politics == The city is ruled over by the Ten Houses, jazuu families with long histories. Several of them contribute servants to the undertaking that is the [[Eldest (Dragon)|Eldest's]] lair. The lower class are almost all dwarven, considered workers at best and scum at worst. The city has no wall or other significant defenses--anyone stupid enough to attack it would be crushed by all the nations of Oelfra. [[Category:Cities]] [[Category:Oelfra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The largest island in [[Gap-tooth Bay]], located about 25 miles from the western shore. Approximately 300 sq mi in area, it is dominated by a gigantic mountain. The few that h..."
revision.text:
The largest island in [[Gap-tooth Bay]], located about 25 miles from the western shore. Approximately 300 sq mi in area, it is dominated by a gigantic mountain. The few that have visited the island since the Cataclysm have reported strange animals, plants, and creatures not found elsewhere, thus giving the island its name.
== Inhabitants == According to information uncovered by [[Ad Elementis]] in 252 AC, the island is inhabited by gnomes acting at the direction of some kind of fey ruler. They are secretive and avoid contact with outsiders. [[Category:Geography]] [[Category:Noefra]] [[Category:Byssia]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Of the [[Elemental lord|Elemental lords]], Pyros is the only pure elemental. While most of the elemental manifestations fade back into the stuff of the plane, Pyros has develo..."
revision.text:
Of the [[Elemental lord|Elemental lords]], Pyros is the only pure elemental. While most of the elemental manifestations fade back into the stuff of the plane, Pyros has developed his own Name, giving him independent existence. It is unclear exactly how this came about, but his consistent personality and identity have been attested since the mid 2nd age.
Some scholars have speculated (without direct evidence) that Pyros is actually an extension of the [[Fountain of Fiery Renewal]], effectively its mouthpiece.
== Personality == Pyros is fickle and has a noted tendency to both destruction and mercy, both usually in their extreme forms. He has no ego or normal place of residence, appearing seemingly at random. [[Category:Plane of Flame]] [[Category:Notable People]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A small nation north-east of the [[Dead Plateau]] and [[Mt. Fearg]], on the south-west border of the [[Hagfen]]. Unusual in that they practice cultural necromancy and "black"..."
revision.text: A small nation north-east of the [[Dead Plateau]] and [[Mt. Fearg]], on the south-west border of the [[Hagfen]]. Unusual in that they practice cultural necromancy and "black" magic, but only in controlled doses along the Hagblight, the carefully maintained dead-lands that hedge in the ever-expanding fen. [[Category:Nations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The nation of Kor Abantu ("Chosen People" in an obscure dialect) occupies the broken seas and islands north of the [[Jinse Empire]] along the eastern coast of [[Noefra]]. Afte..."
revision.text:
The nation of Kor Abantu ("Chosen People" in an obscure dialect) occupies the broken seas and islands north of the [[Jinse Empire]] along the eastern coast of [[Noefra]]. After the [[Cataclysm]] when the Empire retreated from most of those lands, the Abantu were fishers and hardy folks living on the furthest island and many scattered nations occupied the area. Since the ascension of Kor I to the "throne" in 153 AC, the Abantu have spread aggressively and conquered almost all of the islands and even as far as the lands directly south of the Northern Badlands. The unity government fell apart about 20 years ago--it's now a collection of pirate chiefs, tribes, and clans. They stand united for one and only one thing--no outside force will shift them or take their waters.
Slavers, pirates, traders. The Abantu raid, pillage, extort, and yes, trade, as far north as [[Nirda]] and as far south and west as [[Bel's Kush]]. They are the dominant maritime force of the eastern continent. Where they interact with the [[Ship Folk]], they tend to clash but not war. [[Category:Nations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Not much is known about this northern-most nation of [[Noefra]]. Isolated at the head of the Steadfast Bay, with mountains to the south-east, the Northern Wastes to the west,..."
revision.text: Not much is known about this northern-most nation of [[Noefra]]. Isolated at the head of the Steadfast Bay, with mountains to the south-east, the Northern Wastes to the west, and the [[Hagfen]] to the south-west, the only stories and goods about them come from the [[Kor Abantu]]. They are a source of finely-worked ivory and intricate knotwork. [[Category:Nations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Founded by escaped slaves of the dragon-kings that rule the [[Cerulean Desert]], the Free State is the south-eastern-most nation of [[Noefra]]. Notable for the Wardline, a cha..."
revision.text: Founded by escaped slaves of the dragon-kings that rule the [[Cerulean Desert]], the Free State is the south-eastern-most nation of [[Noefra]]. Notable for the Wardline, a chain of enormous ancient statues of unknown make that dragons attempting to enter the territory of the state extremely uncomfortable and "itchy". It is this Wardline that keeps the nation free. It maintains good relationships with the [[Jinse Empire]] and [[Bel's Kush]] via trade facilitated by the [[Kor Abantu]], although the Roltori have become traders in their own right recently. [[Category:Nations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The ultra-orthodox religion that dominates the [[Holy Kaelthian Republic]] since the end of 250 AC and the fall of [[Loran Hae]]. While technically they do not worship any god..."
revision.text:
The ultra-orthodox religion that dominates the [[Holy Kaelthian Republic]] since the end of 250 AC and the fall of [[Loran Hae]]. While technically they do not worship any god or [[ascendant]] power directly, they revere the [[Prophet of Law Unveiled]] as the messenger of Truth itself.
== Precepts ==
# The only salvation for mortals is here, during this life. What comes after is but a shadow and a mockery. # Salvation comes through hard work, unity, and avoiding greed and worldly attachments. # Every person must know and fulfil their place in society without question and without hesitation. All roles are necessary, and none is superior to others. # Profit-seeking is a sin--all must work solely for the good of society and others. # Ostentatious displays of wealth (and in fact the possession of wealth) is a mark of sinful attitudes and pride. Equality of goods is the path toward holiness. # The Law of Truth is also the only law that can be allowed to govern society. There is no separation of church and state--the state must wither away and be subsumed as all bow to the Law Unveiled. # The Prophet proclaims the Truth, but he is not the Truth and is not to be worshipped. # Mortal sins include ## Public intoxication. In fact, all intoxicants are discouraged, in private or not. ## Public immodesty. Sexual relations are for the purpose of child-bearing and bonding within a society. Prostitution must be carefully controlled and kept out of sight. Flaunting sexuality is a form of ostentatious display and is sin. ## Mercantilism (selling goods for a profit beyond what is necessary to survive). Only the wicked seek to profit at the expense of others. ## Denial of the Law. ## Consorting with Unbelievers without authorization. Only the Consecrated may deal with outsiders, and only where absolutely necessary. Outsiders are not allowed on holy grounds (ie beyond the borders). ## Carrying weapons. Only the Hands and their soldiers may go armed beyond a simple knife or woodcutter's axe. Hunting is allowed, but meat consumption is discouraged except when other food is scarse. ## Idleness. Everyone must work--those that do not work are not to eat. ## Acting outside your station in life. Those that do not accept their Law-ordained place must be thrust out of society and shunned.
[[Category:Religion]] [[Category:Holy Kaelthian Republic]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The ancient capital of the [[Jinse Empire]], what remains of the eastern of the two Great Empires of the [[Ages of the World|Third Age]]. Still by far the largest city on the..."
revision.text:
The ancient capital of the [[Jinse Empire]], what remains of the eastern of the two Great Empires of the [[Ages of the World|Third Age]]. Still by far the largest city on the [[Noefra|Noefran]] continent at nearly 200,000 people, it sits at the delta of three great rivers--the Jin, the Luo Ye, and the Huang Sho, surrounded by farmland that mostly goes to feed the maw of the city.
Ruled by 7 great lucian-born (aka [[Plane-touched|tieflings]]) families with ties to 7 of the [[Diabolical Families|lucian Families]], Jinse is a city swarming with devils and devil summoners. Seeing a hell-bred on the streets is common--imps serve their "masters" and sit on shoulders, while succubi staff some of the houses of joy. In reality, the devils are in charge and the families are merely their anchors in the Mortal plane. [[Category:Cities]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The corrupt, beating heart of the [[Hagfen]] and the source of all hags. Standing nearly half a mile tall, it is visible from quite a ways. No one knows where it came from or..."
revision.text:
The corrupt, beating heart of the [[Hagfen]] and the source of all hags. Standing nearly half a mile tall, it is visible from quite a ways. No one knows where it came from or what it is, really. It seeks out those who hunger, who experience extremely strong emotions and offers them power in exchange for their hearts. It implants a seed in their breast, granting them access to its power...in exchange for being fed constantly in the emotion. Rarely are these emotions positive--even the ones that started that way are warped into something dark and destructive over time. It is whispered that eventually, should one realize their desire, the seed will sprout and convert the person into a daughter tree...
Scraps of ancient legend say that the tree has been utterly obliterated many times and has always regrown within a few years, reaching its original height as if nothing had happened. Some say that one can hear it laughing: "as long as there is darkness in the mortal heart, I will live and have fertile ground to plant my seeds..." [[Category:Noefra]]

The western-most province of the [[Jinse Empire]]. Only notionally part of that great empire for the last 50 years, it mostly acts as an independent state. Bordered by [[Shaanti]] on the north, [[Shaadval]] on the west, and the [[Dragonreach]] to the south, it sits exposed and is a site of constant ongoing low-level warfare, mostly conducted by external mercenary groups. At this point, the fighting has become mostly ritualized--no one really wants to upset the status quo and force the other side(s) to do something drastic... [[Category:Jinse Empire]]

The major road that goes from [[Bradford]] up through [[Bradavon]] to [[Baile Craan]] in the [[Sea of Grass]]. So named because many of the prime apiaries of the world lie along this road. Paved or cobbled most of the way, it is wide enough for two heavy wagons to pass with plenty of room between. Wide grass strips are maintained on either side for horses and drainage is good. It is maintained by all the communities that border or feed into the road. It is thus passable except when heavily snowed over, usually only a few days out of the year. Lighter storms are cleared by work crews as they come. [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Duarchy of Kotimaa]] [[Category:Sea of Grass]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The organization within the [[Church of the Seasons]] that particularly serves [[Sakara|Sakara, the Lady of Flowers]]. These are usually young women. They serve as midwives, r..."
revision.text:
The organization within the [[Church of the Seasons]] that particularly serves [[Sakara|Sakara, the Lady of Flowers]]. These are usually young women. They serve as midwives, romantic consultants, and perform blessings of fertility over crops throughout the [[Sea of Grass]]. They used to have a significant temple at the [[Cherry Blossom Temple]] near [[Bradford]], but have abandoned that location after the massacre there. After the reorganization in [[Kaelthia]] in 251 AC, their center of worship and organization is now [[Bradavon]].
The Blossom Maidens are particularly honored by the [[halfling]] population. While they are part of the Church, they serve all without concern for orthodoxy. [[Category:Religion]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Ever wonder why cats stare at things you can't see? Cats have the ability to see Beyond, into the space between this world and [[Shadow]]. They can see the spirits that need a..."
revision.text: Ever wonder why cats stare at things you can't see? Cats have the ability to see Beyond, into the space between this world and [[Shadow]]. They can see the spirits that need assistance passing through the veil, and assist [[Gleaner|gleaners]] in encouraging those who refuse to pass beyond to do so. Those cats that coordinate the efforts of the gleaners and maintain the feline information network are the Catocracy, a shadowy cabal of talking felines. Where their headquarters are is unknown, whether in the Mortal or in [[Shadow]]. It's said that they commune directly with the [[Watcher]], but that too is rumor. What is known is that is that they communicate via eek-mail, which involves a cat killing a mouse and attaching a message to its soul, which it delivers before passing onward. The reaction of unsuspecting mortals gives it its name--they wake up to find a dead mouse lying around and go "eek!". [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Shadow]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The second adventure of the [[Catalysts]], following a request from the town of [[Yuuras Zaali]] to investigate pre-[[Cataclysm]] evidence of an old iron mine south of town in..."
revision.text:
The second adventure of the [[Catalysts]], following a request from the town of [[Yuuras Zaali]] to investigate pre-[[Cataclysm]] evidence of an old iron mine south of town in the [[Sundown Hills]], plus rumors of goblin infestation.
== Events ==
# Travel. Encountered goblins fleeing north. After parlay, they were informed that a [[Twisted]] cultist had taken control of the mine. # Scouting the mine. Discovered twisted flesh-sculptures of goblins, still alive. # Assault on the twisted shaman. Goblin baby bombs. Bor, one of the founding members, was tragically killed in this combat. The shaman, on his defeat, called out to his demon patron and was reborn as an abomination of flesh. # With the mine cleansed, the party discovered records of dwarven manufacturing, including re-discovering the secrets to making metal-armed crossbows, necessary for hand crossbows.
== Aftermath == The mine eventually was re-opened and the town of Bor's Sacrifice founded nearby to provide housing. It is now part of the [[Crisial Kingdom]]. [[Category:Catalysts]] [[Category:Crisial Kingdom]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The last adventure of the [[Catalysts]] on behalf of [[Yuuras Zaali]], summer of 205 AC. Fishermen had started reporting ghostly towers appearing on an unknown island about an..."
revision.text:
The last adventure of the [[Catalysts]] on behalf of [[Yuuras Zaali]], summer of 205 AC. Fishermen had started reporting ghostly towers appearing on an unknown island about an hour's sail north of the town, with an eerie magical barrier preventing access. A scholar and journeyman mage named Robert Spell-wright from the [[Granite-Flame Academy]] in [[Kaelthia]] had come to investigate and needed a bodyguard. The party agreed to help.
== Events ==
# The barrier turned out to be a fairly simple one designed more to ''contain'' than to ''ward out''. Robert bypassed it with some effort. # Landing on the island, it turned out to be the top of a mountain that had sunk when [[Lake Coy'in]] had expanded at the [[Cataclysm]]. Four towers, one of them ruined and burnt, occupied the bulk of the island. Some investigation revealed them to be named the [[Towers of Sun, Earth, Moon, and Stars]]. See that document for more details.
== Aftermath == The towers have become the central home of the [[Sages]] and the [[Guardians of the Forgotten]] Registered Company. They technically pay allegiance to [[Queen Raanee]] of the [[Crisial Kingdom]], but mostly act independently and access requires approval from the Guardians.
== Discoveries == This quest led to the discovery of the [[Portal Network]], as well as the [[Dark Lady]] and gave hints about where she'd ended up. It also led to the discovery that humans were descended from [[goblins]] (and not the other way around), which led directly to the next quest when human-supremacists got involved. [[Category:Catalysts]] [[Category:Crisial Kingdom]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The first adventure of the [[Catalysts]] in the broader world. Took place a few weeks after the [[Cleansing the Four Towers]] in mid-summer 205AC. Precipitated when news of th..."
revision.text:
The first adventure of the [[Catalysts]] in the broader world. Took place a few weeks after the [[Cleansing the Four Towers]] in mid-summer 205AC. Precipitated when news of their discoveries caused human-supremacist groups (primarily the [[Human League]]) to demand their arrest on spurious charges of demon-worship.
== Events ==
# Arrival of [[Alaina]], one of the [[Scale-balancer]] paladins to arrest the party. Quickly nicknamed "Sparkles" for her dynamic hair coloring as an astral [[plane-touched]]. Party invokes their right to appeal to [[Ytra]], requiring them to be returned to [[Kaelthia]] to stand trial before the goddess. # The trial was dramatic, resulting in the summoning of a possessing avatar of the goddess. Party is cleared of all charges and in fact commended. # While investigating the groups that led to their arrest (for revenge, if nothing else), they discovered that the [[Human League]] was being bankrolled by a merchant sub-guild that had gained substantial power very fast. # While investigating ''that'', they discovered a secret underground base full of mercenaries and [[Human League]] goons. At the bottom of that, they discovered that the League (and the merchants) were being manipulated by shadowy forces from the south, in the supposedly destroyed [[Stone Throne]]. The merchant group loses substantial power, and a small shakeup of the administration discovers substantial political and economic corruption of many sorts. # They acquire [[Hound's Rest]] as a reward and clear out the oozes and other weird things inhabiting it, making the hound spirit very happy. They also discovered another [[Portal Network]] entrance.
[[Category:Catalysts]] [[Category:Holy Kaelthian Republic]]

revision.comment: Created page with "AKA "sparkles", but anyone calling her that will likely get smote. == Descriptions == An elderly [[Plane-touched|astral plane-touched]] woman, now in her late 60s. Her hair i..."
revision.text:
AKA "sparkles", but anyone calling her that will likely get smote.
== Descriptions == An elderly [[Plane-touched|astral plane-touched]] woman, now in her late 60s. Her hair is still golden and sheds sparks, but her plate-wearing, foe-smiting days are over...as much as she dislikes that fact. Still has quite a temper. In her earlier years, she served as the Right Hand of the [[Scale Balancer|Scale Balancers]], responsible for operations and armed response. Known for having zero patience for fools...by which she means just about anyone. Literally Holier than Thou.
== Location == Currently the senior member of the [[Scale Balancer]] order, or was until the rise of the [[Prophet of Law Unveiled]], when she and her organization vanished from sight. Last resident in the [[Grand Temple]] at [[Kaelthia]]. [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Holy Kaelthian Republic]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The penultimate (canon) adventure of the [[Catalysts]], taking place in early autumn of 205AC. Following up on the events of [[Into the Twisted Goblin Mine]] and Tree and Ch..."
revision.text:
The penultimate (canon) adventure of the [[Catalysts]], taking place in early autumn of 205AC. Following up on the events of [[Into the Twisted Goblin Mine]] and [[Tree and Child]], the party decided to head south into what is now known as the [[Blood-thirst Wildlands]] to see what is happening with the [[Twisted]]-led corruption. What they discovered changed the face of western [[Noefra]] and ended a great evil.
== Events ==
# They traveled south from [[Yuuras Zaali]] and encountered peaceful [[Goblins|goblin]] tribes who were fleeing north. The goblins of the [[Into the Twisted Goblin Mine|goblin mine]] had been advance groups. # They spent a day chilling with goblins and learned about ritual sites where the corruption was being spread. They also learned about an old pre-[[Cataclysm]] fort in the hills overlooking the corruption. # They decided to move on the fort. There they discovered undead and demon cultists working under what they later learned was the [[Dark Lady]], as well as a [[Portal Network]] entrance. After cleansing the fort, they gained goblin support to fortify it against the corruption. # Knowing that assaulting the ritual sites directly was doomed to failure, they sought out new allies to the west (based on reports). They encountered and made allies with [[Byssia]] (who had been fighting off corruption on their borders) and [[Wyrmhold]], although the latter was too busy dealing with the [[Hungering Frost]] to help much. # With aid from the goblins (who later became the [[Windwalker Confederacy]] and founded [[Fort Hope]] on the site of the old fort), they assaulted the northernmost ritual point and took it, destroying the cultists there. # The Byssian druids gave them an experimental ritual to call down a meteor on the center of the corruption--using the ritual site as a base, they began enacting that ritual against heavy opposition. # As things became more dire, the [[Divine Three]] intervened in avatar form, claiming that they were bound to "finish what they'd started" and that the ritual would fail unless they helped. The avatars took over the ritual itself while the party fended off demon-twisted monsters and eventually an assault from an avatar of the [[Twisted]] himself. # The ritual succeeded, but only revealed the corrupt heart. The party set forth, experiencing some really weird stuff (talking tree stumps with mohawks?). # At the center point, which was the same temple the [[Eyes of Qa'desh|Eye of Qa'desh]] was discovered at (which sparked the [[Cataclysm]]), now ruined by the meteor ritual, they fought a corrupted green dragon (and [[Safrir Tree-friend|Safrir]] nearly died because he thought he could talk to it) and then descended into a [[mkhulu]] nest, eventually destroying the Elder Brain that had ruled the ritual. # Returning to [[Fort Hope]], they found that the [[Dark Lady]] had been attempting to re-establish control via portal, but had been fended off. In the process, she'd revealed the portal coordinates of her home in [[Kel'al'ar]]. The party decided to do something about that.
[[Category:Catalysts]] [[Category:Noefra]] [[Category:Demons]] [[Category:Gods]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The final (canon) adventure of the [[Catalysts]], wherein they liberate the [[Stone Throne]] from a demonic contract, defeat the [[Dark Lady]] (preventing a breach in reality..."
revision.text:
The final (canon) adventure of the [[Catalysts]], wherein they liberate the [[Stone Throne]] from a demonic contract, defeat the [[Dark Lady]] (preventing a breach in reality in the process), and lay the foundation for the [[Federated Nations]]. Takes place in late autumn 205AC.
== Events ==
# The party decides to investigate the [[Jungle of Fangs]] after the events of [[Corruption in Kaelthia]] and [[Into the Twisted Lands]] revealed that there was a potential threat there. # They travel south through the jungle on magic carpet. Along the way, they encounter [[Ar Dolema]], a walking fortress making circles in the jungle. # They free it from assault by demonic forces and discover the fetid bargain that the old [[Fanged Kingdom]] masters made with the [[White Skull]]...and construct a plan to stop it. # Traveling to [[Ar Salem Dolem]], they engage in subterfuge and discover that the [[Queen Ascendant]] (who was a trapped soul in the bargain, acting as an eternally-living filter for the souls of her people) and her [[Handmaiden|Handmaidens]] desired freedom but were imprisoned by some of her clergy. # Shenanigans ensued, including [[Paresten sur Tai Nwyedd|Paresten]] dressing up as a pretty lady to infiltrate a cult/orgy. # After defeating the foes there, they broke the binding stone, freeing the nation from the bargain. They also discovered that the [[Dark Lady|Dark Lady's]] sister, [[Kinlanna]], was seeking redemption for her acts at the [[Towers of Sun, Earth, Moon, and Stars]], and allied with her to provide access to the Lady's estate and a distraction. # The lady had prepared a doomsday ritual to consume the souls of the entire city, vaulting her to [[Demon Princes|Demon Prince]] status. In doing so, she'd broken her bargain with the [[White Skull]], leading him to assist the party as well. # After some rest, they gathered an alliance of soldiers from throughout the free nations to assault the [[Dark Lady|Dark Lady's]] villa via portal, with the alliance acting as a distraction while the party descended into the bowels of the estate to destroy the ritutal. # There, at the showdown, the Lady intervened and after a battle, committed suicide with a [[Fangs of Resolution|Fang of Resolution]], wishing to tear a hole in reality and let the [[Awakener]] in. # [[Kinlanna]], picking up the artifact, led the party through the hole to the borders of the [[Dark Beyond]], where the party did battle with [[Awakener]] forces until [[Kinlanna]] could seal the breach. This she did with the [[Fangs of Resolution|Fang]], sacrificing herself and the fang to form the seal, but letting the party slip back in.
== Aftermath == In the aftermath, the party mostly retired to [[Hound's Rest]] and [[Fort Hope]]. [[Kalesin]] led the [[Kaelthia|Kaelthian]] dragonborn to the aid of [[Wyrmhold]], leading to the final major battle of the [[Hungering Frost]] and the completion of the wall at the end of the [[Last Resort Pass]]. [[Paresten sur Tai Nwyedd|Paresten]] was instrumental in founding the [[Federated Nations]] and still has a role in the government. [[Safrir Tree-friend]] took up leadership of the [[Lady's Grove]] near [[Yuuras Zaali]], and [[Vassarian Kabir|Vassarian]] continued his researches into ways to combat the [[Awakener]], as well as playing a major role in the [[Adventurer’s Guild]]. [[Category:Catalysts]] [[Category:Stone Throne]]

revision.comment: Created page with "An [[Plane-touched|air plane-touched]] human from a small village in the [[Sea of Grass]], he trained with the militia until adulthood when his wanderlust kicked in and he too..."
revision.text: An [[Plane-touched|air plane-touched]] human from a small village in the [[Sea of Grass]], he trained with the militia until adulthood when his wanderlust kicked in and he took up the adventuring life with the group later known as the [[Heroes of Pactum]]. Now in his late 60s, he is the emeritus head of the [[Wind Wolf]] mercenary company *slash* orc tribe operating out of [[Baile Duchas]] along the northern borders of [[Wyrmhold]]. He wields an enchanted greatsword recovered from the [[Pactum Battlefield]] tombs, although he has mostly turned operation over to his daughter, the half-orc Renna. [[Category:Adventurers]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A mercenary group comprised mostly of members of an orc tribe that once assisted the [[Sons of Dawn]] in attempting to loot the [[Pactum Battlefield]]. Under [[Gale|Gale's]] g..."
revision.text: A mercenary group comprised mostly of members of an orc tribe that once assisted the [[Sons of Dawn]] in attempting to loot the [[Pactum Battlefield]]. Under [[Gale|Gale's]] guidance, they've moved over into [[Wyrmhold]] where they take on operations against wildlife and hostile tribes in the [[Fiach Wood]]. [[Category:Unfinished]] [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Wyrmhold]]

revision.comment: Created page with "An organization devoted to "freeing" the northern [[Council Lands]] (now the [[Duarchy of Kotimaa]]) from [[Kaelthia|Kaelthian]] dominance. Their big gig was attempting to rai..."
revision.text:
An organization devoted to "freeing" the northern [[Council Lands]] (now the [[Duarchy of Kotimaa]]) from [[Kaelthia|Kaelthian]] dominance. Their big gig was attempting to raid the [[Pactum Battlefield]] for weapons after being beguiled by members of the cult of the [[Jester]] and getting spanked by the [[Heroes of Pactum]] and their allies.
Since 210 AC, they've been defunct, although the name keeps getting resurrected for new causes. [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Duarchy]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A [[cysgor]] male and former Owl who was exiled for getting involved with the stories he was chronicling. Played a minor role in the events at the [[Pactum Battlefield]] in 21..."
revision.text: A [[cysgor]] male and former Owl who was exiled for getting involved with the stories he was chronicling. Played a minor role in the events at the [[Pactum Battlefield]] in 210 AC. Current whereabouts unknown. [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Cysgoroesi]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A now-defunct organization who wanted to overthrow the [[Council Lands Government]] in 210 AC and re-establish a monarchy in [[Dreamshore]], to be ruled by Coldwind|Lady Col..."
revision.text: A now-defunct organization who wanted to overthrow the [[Council Lands Government]] in 210 AC and re-establish a monarchy in [[Dreamshore]], to be ruled by [[Coldwind|Lady Coldwind]] as a figurehead. Really, they were pawns of the [[Jester]] cult, who wanted to cause anarchy. They were spanked and sent home by the [[Heroes of Pactum]] and their allies and the organization collapsed. Ironically enough, after the dissolution of the Council system, that area did become an aristocracy under Lady [[Coldwind]], but with her as an active ruler, not figurehead. [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

The first adventure of the [[Shame Menders]], in early 210 AC. The party found themselves hired to go to [[Fuar Uulan]] and figure out the causes of the unrest among that normally stable population.
'''WARNING: CONJECTURE'''
The remainder of this is only known fragmentarily, from diaries of people involved.
The party discovered that there were multiple groups claiming that the ruling clans had no right to do so. There had been attempts to break into the Deep Archives, and odd occurrences there leading to them being sealed. Turns out the groups were being manipulated by the dragon [[Gozh]], who had a grudge against the Alkh clan.
The party, after making allies of the Listener, managed to get access, where they discovered the truth of the situation:
The Alkh clan had betrayed the Bolor clan before the [[Cataclysm]], letting raiders into their clan hold so they could steal the [[Rune Anvil]]. They had contracted with [[Gozh]] for magic to help them in exchange for a fossilized dragon's egg...but had welshed on their part of the deal. And, to top it all off, had lied in official writings about this.
The party decided to use this information to blackmail the entire top council (who knew about it) into resigning in disgrace, leaving their successors unaware of it. They managed to chase Gozh out by confronting that coward. They did not reveal the truth of the matter to anyone.
Soon afterward, the party, along with dissatisfied individuals and the (repentant) council, started a trek north-west toward the old Alkh and Bolor clan holds. [[Category:Campaigns]] [[Category:Historical Interest]] [[Category:Uulan Confederacy]]

A short adventure of the [[Shame Menders]] in late 210 AC.
The party, along with a company of dwarves under the command of [[Theobard III]], headed up toward the old dwarven homeland in the [[Giant Spine Mountains]]. Seeking winter shelter and a place to build a new society (because the dwarves were fed up with traditionalism), they found a valley with the old [[Aidas]] clan hold in it, now shadow infested.
They cleaned out the shadows, discovering that it had been the site of a [[Cysgoroesi]] gateway, which had leaked. There the city of [[Shinevog]] was founded. [[Category:Campaigns]] [[Category:Shinevog]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A [[Soul-forged|steel-skin soul-forged]], Dimwit awoke as a military supply construct. He took up both magic and fighting, but was never great at either until he joined up wit..."
revision.text:
A [[Soul-forged|steel-skin soul-forged]], Dimwit awoke as a military supply construct. He took up both magic and fighting, but was never great at either until he joined up with the [[Dimwit Syndicate]] (named after him) adventuring group. He became somewhat of a leader.
The appellation "Dimwit" is of unknown origin, but probably caused by doing something stupid due to poor impulse control.
== Current Whereabouts == Currently, he is one of the leaders of the [[Serpentstrike]] registered company, alongside Shiv, his former adventuring companion. [[Category:Adventurers]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Its original name is lost to history (or buried), but Two-mind is what everyone calls this half-elven (fang-kin) bard. Born in the [[Stone Throne]], they were originally twins..."
revision.text:
Its original name is lost to history (or buried), but Two-mind is what everyone calls this half-elven (fang-kin) bard. Born in the [[Stone Throne]], they were originally twins while in the womb. But only one baby came out...with two minds. One female, one male. They don't always get along.
== Current Whereabouts == Two-mind is one of the leadership of [[Serpentstrike]], serving as a propaganda officer. It is also active in the community in [[Tarad'am]]. Age 57. [[Category:Adventurers]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Born on the islands of the [[Gap-tooth Bay]] to a group of tribals only loosely affiliated with [[Byssia]], he was exiled from his tribe after his connection to [[Selesurala]]..."
revision.text:
Born on the islands of the [[Gap-tooth Bay]] to a group of tribals only loosely affiliated with [[Byssia]], he was exiled from his tribe after his connection to [[Selesurala]] was discovered in early adulthood. Saved by the goddess's intervention (or so he believes), he wandered until deciding to take up adventuring and joining up with the [[Wild Cards]].
Killed by a [[mkhulu]] in 211 AC in what is now [[Zhapai Karmap]], he was resurrected by [[Dilligas Husty]] in 250 AC and has taken leadership of a small fleet of trading vessels in the [[Serpent Sea]]. [[Category:Adventurers]] [[Category:Wild Cards]] [[Category:Enigma]]

page.title: Intrigue and Horses and Spies Oh My! (Campaign)

revision.comment: Created page with "The introductory campaign of the [[Heroes Foretold]], taking place in early spring of 250 AC in [[Vaeltaa]]. Only included Thel and Reginald. The party, each for their own pu..."
revision.text:
The introductory campaign of the [[Heroes Foretold]], taking place in early spring of 250 AC in [[Vaeltaa]]. Only included Thel and Reginald.
The party, each for their own purposes, ended up in [[Vaeltaa]] when the [[Horse Clans]] were blockading the town. They discovered a hornet's nest of factors--
* Special agents from [[Wyrmhold]] were attempting to cause chaos so that Wyrmhold would have a justification to take control of the trade routes and town. * Certain corrupt [[Crisial Kingdom]] agents were taking bribes from everyone and letting everything fall apart. * The [[Horse Clans]] were seeking after two escapees, one child who was set to be sacrificed to [[Vetel]] and her gnomish guardian. * A necromancer was making a mess.
The party managed to navigate these waters, rescue the child and guardian, and make (partial) peace with the [[Horse Clans]], which enabled [[Ad Elementis]] to finish the overthrow of [[Vetel]] the next winter.
They then left for [[Fort Hope]] with the two escapees, just ahead of Thel's family. [[Category:Campaigns]] [[Category:Crisial Kingdom]]

The full campaign of the [[Heroes Foretold]], where they opened up lost [[Auringon]] and completed the Tale of Ages. Time: summer 250 AC.
== Events == The party was hired by [[Dashingwell]] to accompany a delegation heading to a new nation to the west of [[Byssia]] on the [[Lost Coast]], which had very recently made contact.
# Along the way, they encountered refugees and raiders from the south, fleeing the [[Tlalocana]]. Some were demon-influenced. # Entering into [[Auringon]], they found themselves enmeshed in the Tale, which turned the place into a fairy-tale kingdom of knights and nobles...with a dark heart. # They encountered treachery at the hands of one of the Dukes, but overcame it. They found that he had been poisoning the king to influence the Tale and manipulate the heir. # They also found the situation becoming more dire as [[Meztlan]] refugees from the [[Drowned Coast]] were pressing in. # Braving the test of the [[Elder Library]] with the help of the book-obsessed brass dragon Katie, they found that an ancient Tome of stories, now a semi-sentient artifact, had been contracted to preserve the people. This was imposing the Tale on them. # They became the [[Heroes Foretold]] in this tale, ending it and closing the Tome.
== Aftermath ==
* Thel settled down at the Library with Katie to do research. * Reginald married into one of the noble houses of [[Auringon]] and is now a duke. * Morlan replaced the former high priest of [[Roel Kor]] and is heading up the efforts to integrate the [[Meztlan]] refugees and prepare for the upcoming expected invasion by [[Tlalocana]]. * The remainder are floating around and haven't made their names known recently. * [[Auringon]] is (as of 252 AC) formally a junior member of the [[Federated Nations]]. [[Category:Campaigns]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The regional name for the peninsula south of [[Auringon]] down around to the mouth of [[Gap-tooth Bay]]. Occupied mostly by tribal humans and orcs (and mixed-breeds) until rec..."
revision.text: The regional name for the peninsula south of [[Auringon]] down around to the mouth of [[Gap-tooth Bay]]. Occupied mostly by tribal humans and orcs (and mixed-breeds) until recently, when the [[Tlalocana|Tlalocanan]] empire has taken control. Before that, it was the home of the [[Meztlan Empire]]. [[Category:Regions]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A recently rediscovered enchanted library home to historical works and stories, as well as the Tome of Tales, an artifact-grade sentient magic book bound to the library. Locat..."
revision.text: A recently rediscovered enchanted library home to historical works and stories, as well as the Tome of Tales, an artifact-grade sentient magic book bound to the library. Located near the capital of [[Auringon]] and central to the campaign [[Unravelling the Tale (Campaign)|Unravelling the Tale]]. Currently being watched over by Thel of the [[Heroes Foretold]] and his dragon-friend Katie (a brass dragon obsessed with stories, child of [[Marcia (Dragon)|Marcelline]], the dragon who once was part of the [[Refuge Seekers]]. [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Auringon]]

The collective name for the inhabitants of the [[Drowned Coast]]. Mostly humans and orcs (the orcs descended from from the Army of Chaos at the [[Cataclysm War]]). Many of them have fallen and been subsumed into the [[Tlalocana|Tlalocanan]] nation. Technically, "meztlan" only refers to the human folks, but most use it for all the refugees in [[Auringon]] unless they need to specify.
Many of the refugee meztlans settled in [[Auringon]], while the k'jin headed further north along the [[Lost Coast]]. The uacmin were denied passage and stay in the swamps south of the Cascade.
== Subgroups ==
* Humans: meztlan * K'jin: orcs and mixed bloods * Uacmin: demon-worshipers. Shunned by the others.
[[Category:Nations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The title given to the leader of the [[Sun Shields]] in the [[Council Lands]] and post-breakup kingdoms. He (always male) is the high priest of [[Tor Elan]] of the Church of..."
revision.text:
The title given to the leader of the [[Sun Shields]] in the [[Council Lands]] and post-breakup kingdoms. He (always male) is the high priest of [[Tor Elan]] of the [[Church of the Seasons]]. The holder gives up his former name and assumes the faceless identity.
== Current Title Holder == The title is currently in dispute--the last undisputed holder vanished when the [[Prophet of Law Unveiled]] took over in [[Kaelthia]]. There are three priests who are seen as possible title holders (one each in Rauviz, Godsfall, and Crisial City), but the god has not spoken to claim one of them yet. [[Category:Notable People]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Gwerin achmage of the [[Granite-Flame Academy]] from 150 to 210 AC. Died of consequences of wenching at the ripe old age of 202--his nubile "apprentices" caused a heart attack..."
revision.text: Gwerin achmage of the [[Granite-Flame Academy]] from 150 to 210 AC. Died of consequences of wenching at the ripe old age of 202--his nubile "apprentices" caused a heart attack while they were amorously engaged. Notable for being a true archmage capable of casting legendary spells. In his younger years at least--by the time of the [[Catalysts]] no one had seen him cast a spell bigger than a cantrip in decades. [[Category:Holy Kaelthian Republic]] [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A pre-[[Cataclysm]] dwarven clan, whose clanhold was located in the foothills of the [[Giant Spine Mountains]]. Clan Aidas survived the Cataclysm and went into isolation, but..."
revision.text:
A pre-[[Cataclysm]] dwarven clan, whose clanhold was located in the foothills of the [[Giant Spine Mountains]]. Clan Aidas survived the Cataclysm and went into isolation, but perished soon afterward due to infighting and [[Shadow]]-caused insanity. The clan elders made a deal with rogue [[cysgor]] for a portal into Shadow to maintain their power despite the effects of the Cataclysm; this portal had side effects that poisoned minds and caused the clan to self destruct.
Known to be iconoclastic and arcane-oriented much more than most dwarves. It is thus appropriate that the city built around their abandoned clan hold, [[Shinevog]], embraces invention and the arcane in all its forms. [[Category:Dwarves]] [[Category:Noefra]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

revision.comment: Created page with "An [[Plane-touched|infernal plane-touched]] illusionist who mostly just wanted to fish. A founding member of [[Zephryte]]. Currently trawling his line around the Gap-tooth..."
revision.text:
An [[Plane-touched|infernal plane-touched]] illusionist who mostly just wanted to fish. A founding member of [[Zephryte]].
Currently trawling his line around the [[Gap-tooth Bay]] on their ship. [[Category:Adventurers]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A powerful, insane fey entity amalgamated out of the tortured fey and kami at a [[Tibor Imperia|Imperial]] research facility in the swamps near the [[Byssia|Byssian]] eastern..."
revision.text:
A powerful, insane fey entity amalgamated out of the tortured fey and kami at a [[Tibor Imperia|Imperial]] research facility in the swamps near the [[Byssia|Byssian]] eastern border. Locked out of time by a self-sacrificing [[concept bomb]] detonated by the facility defenders when it ran rampant. Took the form of a giant tree drawing on the facility's soul reactor.
Had the power to manipulate minds of kami and fey to a large range, which it used to manipulate various forces into trying to start a war. Ally of the [[Circle of Purging Flame]] in this regard.
Destroyed in 250 AC by [[Zephryte]]. [[Category:Fey]] [[Category:Noefra]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A meta-circle of primal practitioners, "barbarian" tribes, fey, and those generally opposed to civilization. They seek to reduce the Spoken races to a tribal existence "coexis..."
revision.text:
A meta-circle of primal practitioners, "barbarian" tribes, fey, and those generally opposed to civilization. They seek to reduce the Spoken races to a tribal existence "coexisting" with nature but not using industrial or arcane technology. They are not a centralized group as much as they are an alliance of disparate cells. They all share a belief that they can use the [[Firebird|Firebird's]] destructive side to "cleanse" the planet of civilization.
Dire enemies of the [[Circle of Radiant Wings]], another meta-circle devoted to nurturing the benevolent side of the [[Firebird|Firebird.]]
== Known Cells ==
* A cell comprised of a druidic circle in the swamps of eastern [[Byssia]] was destroyed by [[Zephryte]] in 250 AC as part of dealing with [[The Leshok]]. * Another cell of unknown origin tried to recruit [[Ad Elementis]] but were rejected soundly in 252 AC in [[Kozhuyn]].
[[Category:Organizations]]

revision.comment: Created page with "AKA "Primal Phoenix", this Great Spirit embodies a dual nature--destruction and rebirth/healing. Not to be confused with the lesser [[phoenix]], which are echoes of one side o..."
revision.text:
AKA "Primal Phoenix", this Great Spirit embodies a dual nature--destruction and rebirth/healing. Not to be confused with the lesser [[phoenix]], which are echoes of one side or the other of its nature.
Originally an ephemeral spirit called into existence whenever a wildfire reached a certain critical mass, it was synonymous with devastation until the 3rd age. When the Firebird manifested, no mortal force could quell its flames--it would burn everything down to fine ash and the only solution was to flee to barren ground.
In the time between the 2nd and 3rd age, desperate primalists discovered that by creating a focus (known as the Jade Phoenix) and binding the manifested Firebird with willing blood sacrifices, they could temper the flames, creating the other side of its nature--the flames that purify and bring healing. Doing so meant it would take up residence in a mortal host, granting them healing powers and long life. Since then, it is much more known for this beneficent side than for the catastrophic side.
Two organizations are devoted to the Firebird, one to each nature:
* The [[Circle of Purging Flame]] hopes to reawaken the catastrophe and purge the continent of the "cancer" of civilization. * The [[Circle of Radiant Wings]] has nurtured the benevolent side, picking hosts and opposing the Purging Flame wherever possible.
[[Category:Fey]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A meta circle of primal practitioners, border walkers, herbalists, witches, and healers who revere the healing aspect of the [[Firebird]] and nurture that side to benefit the..."
revision.text:
A meta circle of primal practitioners, border walkers, herbalists, witches, and healers who revere the healing aspect of the [[Firebird]] and nurture that side to benefit the Spoken races. They bitterly oppose the [[Circle of Purging Flame]], and the latter tries to obliterate cells of Radiant Wings wherever possible. As a result, the Circle of Radiant Wings tends to hide its affiliation.
== Known cells ==
* The Kelshanne family of noted druids and healers in the eastern [[Sea of Grass]] are the senior members of the Circle, having the responsibility to maintain the hosts of the [[Firebird]]'s essence.
[[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A large island located in a huge bay between the northern and southern halves of [[Oelfra]]. Dominated by a supervolcano inhabited by the [[Eldest (Dragon)|Eldest Dragon]], th..."
revision.text: A large island located in a huge bay between the northern and southern halves of [[Oelfra]]. Dominated by a supervolcano inhabited by the [[Eldest (Dragon)|Eldest Dragon]], the acknowledged "ruler of dragons". The only city or settlement on the island is [[Toryuu City]] on the south-west side, nestled against the flanks of the volcano. [[Category:Regions]] [[Category:Oelfra]]

The capital city of [[Ikela]] since the [[Kozhun]] was defeated. Located in the delta of a major river, it is not the oldest city ([[Mirzapor]] is older), nor is it the richest or most fashionable ([[Varanasi]] takes that crown), but it is the heart of the nation. [[Category:Cities]] [[Category:Ikela]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A hag is a person (male or female) who has struck a deal with the [[Mother Tree]], replacing their heart (metaphorically and literally) with a seed of that corrupt entity. The..."
revision.text:
A hag is a person (male or female) who has struck a deal with the [[Mother Tree]], replacing their heart (metaphorically and literally) with a seed of that corrupt entity. They gain drastically extended life and magical power in exchange for being dependent on the tree. Specifically, each hag is obsessed with one particular emotion or action, usually a negative one. Envy, strife, gossip, pain (causing or feeling), despair. Each one grants different powers, but the hag must wallow in that emotion constantly. If they don't, the seed shrivels up and dies, killing the hag. And if they sate themselves and find release from whatever caused this obsession...the seed sprouts and they become a daughter tree, cursed to sentient malevolence eternally.
Note that hags do not have to physically travel to the [[Hagfen]]--the tree magically reaches out to those that are in extremis or deep in obsession, offering power in exchange for service. [[Category:Creatures]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The youngest daughter of [[Rajai Jala]], a 14-year-old human girl living in the [[Jala]] region of [[Ikela]]. Born the daughter of a serving woman, she was later legitimized b..."
revision.text: The youngest daughter of [[Rajai Jala]], a 14-year-old human girl living in the [[Jala]] region of [[Ikela]]. Born the daughter of a serving woman, she was later legitimized by her father. [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Ikela]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The training ground for the [[Handmaiden|Handmaidens]] of the [[Jungle of Fangs]], this secluded estate/monastery in southern [[Asai'ka]] is a combination monastery, finishing..."
revision.text:
The training ground for the [[Handmaiden|Handmaidens]] of the [[Jungle of Fangs]], this secluded estate/monastery in southern [[Asai'ka]] is a combination monastery, finishing school, and assassin training ground.
