revision.comment: Created page with "Maerik Mar'osh is the founding king of the "kingdom" of [[Mar'osh]]. A 35 year old [[Orcs|orc]] of a now nearly obliterated tribe native to the [[Fiach Wood]], he had traveled..."
revision.text:
Maerik Mar'osh is the founding king of the "kingdom" of [[Mar'osh]]. A 35 year old [[Orcs|orc]] of a now nearly obliterated tribe native to the [[Fiach Wood]], he had traveled extensively in his teens and twenties, studying history and business in [[Godsfall]]. Physically, he is an imposing figure, standing well over 6' tall and 350 lbs of muscle. He is an accomplished warrior--he wears the skin of a manticore he strangled to death after it broke his (previous) weapon. He uses this appearance as a blind, concealing his keen intellect and interest in the economic and social health of his nation.
== Driving Motivation == Maerik is driven by a strong hatred for the inter-tribe warfare that dominated the life of the tribes of the Wood, the incessant raids and vendettas that destroyed his tribe. He also detests the meddling of (mainly [[Wyrmhold|Wyrmholder]]) outsiders that spurred on some of that violence. He is driven to unify as many of his people as possible so that they can stand independent against other nations and keep the peace.
His primary blind-spot is his sister (the only other survivor of his tribe), [[Diedre Mar'osh]]. He knows, intellectually, that she's engaged in some shady stuff. But he seems incapable (or at least highly resistant) to facing the truth of her actions, allowing her to shed the blame onto others. [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Mar'osh]] [[Category:Orc]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Head of the [[Witches of Mar'osh]] and a powerful enchantress. One of two remaining members of the original Mar'osh tribe, along with her brother, King [[Maerik Mar'osh]]. Die..."
revision.text:
Head of the [[Witches of Mar'osh]] and a powerful enchantress. One of two remaining members of the original Mar'osh tribe, along with her brother, King [[Maerik Mar'osh]]. Diedre is an attractive (if you like them muscular) [[Orcs|orc]] woman in her early thirties. She stands about 6' tall with black hair and compelling violet eyes.
== History == Diedre was noted for her magical potential quite young, and sent off to apprentice under the exiled [[Wyrmhold]] mage [[EsJay vo'Gal]] at [[Scaeva Tower]] at age 7. EsJay, in his fashion, both taught her and abused her (sexually and physically). At 15, she ended her apprenticeship and fled to [[Wyrmhold]], where her history becomes murkier. It is believed that she spent at least some of this time among the criminal elements of that kingdom.
== Personality == Diedre is a chameleon, at least on the surface. She excels at showing the face that people expect to see, at addressing people's concerns. She is never publicly antagonistic or hostile. She uses sexuality as a (very skillful) tool, but never committing her self to any relationships. [[Category:Mar'osh]] [[Category:Notable People]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A mage tower in the (ruined) city of Scaeva, located on the edge of the [[Fiach Wood]] about a day south of [[Mar'osh]]'s borders and two days east of [[Wyrmhold]]'s boundarie..."
revision.text:
A mage tower in the (ruined) city of Scaeva, located on the edge of the [[Fiach Wood]] about a day south of [[Mar'osh]]'s borders and two days east of [[Wyrmhold]]'s boundaries. Rebuilt about 30 years ago by [[EsJay vo'Gal]], an exiled [[Wyrmhold]] conjurer and artificer. It served as his base of operations and home for his apprentices/slaves until his death in late spring 252 AC. After his death, the tower has been occupied by a team of [[Selan's Seekers]] and others.
The tower consists of four above-ground levels and two underground levels, plus a covered roof.
== Above Ground == The ground floor is devoted to apprentice quarters, kitchen and dining facilities, and a public office.
The second floor has three larger quarters, once occupied by [[Devil|devils]] bound to EsJay's service, as well as a common lounge area.
The third floor was EsJay's private library and study. Only those escorted by the mage himself were allowed to this level and beyond.
The fourth floor was EsJay's living quarters.
The roof held a permanent teleportation circle. It has a gazebo roof, but no sides.
== Below Ground == The first basement was a manufactory for devil-empowered constructs.
The second basement was a combination of storage and summoning chambers, where arcane-talented children were imprisoned and forced to give their life-force and wear away at their souls summoning/binding fragments of [[lucian]] entities into containers to serve as the motive force for constructs. [[Category:Places]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "EsJay was an older red [[dragonborn]] conjurer and artificer of some renown and utterly repellent morals. Killed by <campaign 4> in early spring of 252 AC at [[Scaeva Tower]]...."
revision.text:
EsJay was an older red [[dragonborn]] conjurer and artificer of some renown and utterly repellent morals. Killed by <campaign 4> in early spring of 252 AC at [[Scaeva Tower]].
== Early Life == EsJay was born to a collateral, but still noble family of the [[Gal]] clan near [[Lyodnoir]] in 192 AC. Trained as a mage, he specialized in conjury and the creation of automatons--he was part of the effort to make the last generation of construct workers used to build the [[Frostbound Wall]].
He gained substantial renown as a mage, developing innovative ways of making smarter, more capable constructs via selective targeting and implanting of various forces as their motive power. He did have a reputation as a bit of a sleazy person, frequenting the more disreputable red light district houses.
== Disgrace and Exile == In mid 30s, EsJay had built a small group of apprentices, journeymen, and fellow researchers. Rumors spread of his seeming sadistic pleasure in "disciplining" his apprentices, but since he preferred taking apprentices from the lower classes and had strong connections to nobility, nothing ever came of it. However, when he raped the daughter of the wrong person (an influential merchant), the whole thing tumbled down. This also coincided with a post-[[Hungering Frost]] drive to clean up society, but he had a lot of political pull...and so he was exiled instead of executed.
== Scaeva Tower == He found and rebuilt (with [[devil]] help) the old mage tower at Scaeva, and began farming out his construct creation services. Gaining apprentices from all around (especially [[Mar'osh]], through back channels), he flourished.
== Death == In 252 AC, the four members of <campaign 4> arrived at the tower on a scouting mission. He welcomed them in, with the intent to drug and abuse/use-up [[Tyra Blackstone]] for her magical abilities. This was discovered, in part due to one of his hired [[Devil|devils]] welshing on him, and, after an attempted defense (mostly cowardly hiding behind his apprentices), he was pulverized. Literally ground to a paste by [[Asher Frye]]. [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Wyrmhold]] [[Category:Historical Interest]]

A sprawling, but sparsely-populated duchy in the [[Duarchy of Kotimaa]], located in the western [[Dreamwall Mountains]]. Since 250 AC, it has started growing substantially with the new port at [[Honedaxe]] and the rediscovery of the gnomes of Sanctuary and Violetmill, but is still the second-least-influential duchy in the nation.
== Rulers ==
* Duke [[Yor'och Westmountain]], also Yarl Cragholm and ruler of Dinter. ** Baron Dinter * Yarl Goldmountain: Home is Thorscross, rules the western half. ** Baron Sumpter: Baron of Cragdale and (technically, but this is changing) Honedaxe ** Chief Mesal: ruler of the time-lost [[Orcs|orc]] tribe that has settled in Mesaleigh ** Mayor Dunthwistle: representative of the gnomes of Sanctuary and Violetmill.
== Towns == (In order of decreasing size)
* [[Cragholm]] * [[Cragdale]] * Dinter * Thorscross * [[Honedaxe]] * Sanctuary * Violetmill * Mesaleigh
[[Category:Duarchy of Kotimaa]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Only a few records remain, mostly in [[Godsfall]] and the [[Towers of Sun, Earth, Moon, and Stars]] of this event. What is known is that it brought an end to the Unification..."
revision.text:
Only a few records remain, mostly in [[Godsfall]] and the [[Towers of Sun, Earth, Moon, and Stars]] of this event. What is known is that it brought an end to the [[Unification Wars]] that roiled [[Noefra]] after the end of the [[War of Blood]]. It divided the continent at the [[Giant Spine Mountains]] into two territories, each of which then were claimed (in principle, if not in practice) by the two great empires, [[Tibor Imperia]] to the west and [[Quan Pei]] to the east.
It established borders that wouldn't significantly change until the [[War of Souls]] destroyed [[Tibor Imperia]] and put an end to wars between the two great powers, although raiding still occurred, as did piracy.
== Signatories ==
* Signing for the west was the Rai Gaena, later called "the Uniter" and the first true emperor of [[Tibor Imperia]]. She had unified most of the west either through conquest or through alliances. * Signing for the east was the first God Emperor of [[Quan Pei]], Yao Shun. Already revered as a deific figure, his empire was more secure. * Present, but not signing was a representative of the dragons of the [[Dragonreach]]--they quickly reached an agreement with [[Quan Pei]] to stay out of anyone's control, in exchange for not meddling in the affairs of the empires.
Notably ''not'' involved were the "beast" races--the orcs, goblins, and giant-kin. [[Category:Historical Interest]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Very little is known about the period immediately following the [[War of Blood]], other than that, after a short period where all the peoples recovered from that orgy of blood..."
revision.text:
Very little is known about the period immediately following the [[War of Blood]], other than that, after a short period where all the peoples recovered from that orgy of bloodletting, war resumed. But this time ''religious'' war. The victorious humans, backed on both sides by ihmisi, dwarves, gwerin, and jazuu began struggling for dominance. Two sides quickly emerged--the tight pantheon of the [[Golden Aspects]] (represented by the God Emperors) and the looser, more fractious pantheons of the west, mostly revolving around the [[First Heroes]], now ascended.
For decades, the two pantheons and their mortal representatives worked to eliminate all opposition in their respective domains. All the other gods and worshipers either bent the knee or were obliterated, with only a few exceptions. No one really cared what the "beasts" (ie orcs, goblins, etc) believed--they were pushed out of society everywhere. A few other small groups retained their gods--the [[Nocthians]] and the [[Fanged Kingdom]] among them. And, of course, no one was stupid enough to try to force the dragons to convert.
When the two nascent empires finally turned their attention to the others, a few seasons of cataclysmic battles ensued until the two sides decided that further fighting was fruitless and met to negotiate the [[Unification Treaty]], ending the wars. [[Category:Wars]] [[Category:Historical Interest]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "A mortal of the very early [[Ages of the World|3rd Age]], who ascended to [[Old Gods|goodhood]] as a patron of justice, rebirth, and the moons. Before his ascension, he and ..."
revision.text:
A mortal of the very early [[Ages of the World|3rd Age]], who ascended to [[Old Gods|goodhood]] as a patron of justice, rebirth, and the moons. Before his ascension, he and [[Nocthis]] were married and adventured together, although they differed tremendously in age. He ascended, she did not. But jealous of his power, she schemed to strip him of his power via arcane means (being a powerful mage) and stole the deific status from him, imprisoning him in a lava demiplane-prison for the next 4-5 thousand years. She ruthlessly suppressed any memory of his worship among his (now her) people and instituted a matriarchy.
He was released by [[Half Measures]] in 250 AC, and (much depowered, with only a single worshiper in his [[Ascendant]] state) he took up quiet residence in the [[Halfway House]]. He and [[Nocthis]], now merely [[Ascendant]] herself, have reconciled at least partially, although their relationship is still uncertain and delicate. In fall of 251 AC, he accepted the request from [[Half Measures]] to be their chosen candidate to seek the [[Glacierheart]] and become the next lord of the [[Plane of Ice]].
== Personality == Quiet and reserved, Elphas comes across as hard to ruffle and merciful. He is not ''soft'', and has no patience for demons or those who willingly do evil.
== Appearance == Basically Gandalf the white, but golden blonde instead of white. [[Category:Ascended Heroes]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Created page with "The nechrarchs were a death-aspected cult in [[Old Wyrmhold]], responsible for keeping the lineages of the people and for tending to the tombs. They dabbled in [[blood magic]]..."
revision.text:
The nechrarchs were a death-aspected cult in [[Old Wyrmhold]], responsible for keeping the lineages of the people and for tending to the tombs. They dabbled in [[blood magic]] (of the less black sorts) and the transmigration of the soul.
It is believed that all nechrarchs were killed when [[Old Wyrmhold]] fell to the [[Hungering Frost]]. Their quarters in the Royal Crypt were sealed by [[Half Measures]] in 250 AC. [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Nocthian Caldera]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Buried several stories under the old [[Nocthians|Nocthian]] military HQ located in [[Nighthold]] in the [[Nocthian Caldera]] is the Apocalypse Archive, a dimensionally-incoher..."
revision.text:
Buried several stories under the old [[Nocthians|Nocthian]] military HQ located in [[Nighthold]] in the [[Nocthian Caldera]] is the Apocalypse Archive, a dimensionally-incoherent space watched over by the [[Apocalypse Archivist|Apocalypse Archivists]], sentient machines. In the Archive are housed the artifacts recovered over the entire [[Ages of the World|Third Age]] by the "recovery teams"...or at least those artifacts deemed too dangerous or inscrutable to be repurposed or studied elsewhere. It is not known how large this space is, but it certainly acts much like a (much larger) bag of holding--the actual cave is much smaller than the contents and navigating the space is not simple unless guided by an Archivist. It is believed that many thousands of artifacts, ranging from "seriously annoying" to "world-ending threat" are housed here. Some behave as if they are sentient themselves; others are simply incredibly attractive nuisances.
== Examples ==
* A gold coin that, when flipped in context of a decision, always ensures success (at least locally) for the indicated action. At the cost of massive, crippling, frequently lethal bad luck for everyone else in a 1 mile radius for an unstable period of time. * A simple cubical box. Inside the box is another identical box. Removing the inner box causes both boxes to open and release more boxes, which then release more boxes, etc. It stops at about 1 square mile of boxes 10' thick (in the center). After 24 hours, all the boxes except the original disappear. * The original broom of cleaning, which only has a start mode, not a stop mode. * Many others whose nature is unknown, except for "it was found at the center of a 10 mile radius of utter destruction."
[[Category:Places]] [[Category:Nocthian Caldera]]

revision.comment: Created page with "One of the very oldest [[fey]] known to exist, The Morrigan (her name/title always includes the article) has been called [[Fey courts|Queen of the Winter Court]], but she woul..."
revision.text:
One of the very oldest [[fey]] known to exist, The Morrigan (her name/title always includes the article) has been called [[Fey courts|Queen of the Winter Court]], but she would dispute that--there are many Winter Courts and many Queens. Her existence has been continuously attested since the [[Ages of the World|Interregnum]], and her nature has not changed significantly since those earliest records.
== Appearance == The Morrigan appears to be a supremely beautiful, alabaster-skinned, ebony-haired woman of indeterminate age...unless you look at her eyes, which have seen millennia. Her "true form" as seen via truesight is...beautiful and horrible beyond words. Looking on her that way is not advised. She normally wears stark, simple, nearly-sheer robes of black and silver [[moonthistle]] silk and what appears to be an elaborate, black-feathered cape that conceals most of her form. A closer inspection shows that the cape is really made of countless ravens born of Shadow itself, spreading their wings over her.
Her presence is such that most mortals find it difficult to look at her or speak except falteringly.
== Personality == As an archfey, she is ''nearly'' human in personality, but that ''nearly'' only makes her more alien. She rarely shows emotion except for a faint amusement, but that calm demeanor does not mean she won't sentence someone to death...or worse on a whim. Her obsession is ''memory and valor''--she is the patron of valiant warriors, whether villain or hero. And she holds close the memories of their grudges and wars. It's said that she was a patron of the [[Cysgoroesi]]--if that is correct, the bond has long-since been severed.
She is known to be approachable by mortals, finding their boldness and desperation to be amusing. She deals fairly, although like all fey, her deals frequently have more layers than expected. She ''hates'' to be in someone else's debt.
== Home == The Morrigan holds court at the [[Palace of Shimmering Waters]] in the [[Dreamlands]], co-located with the eastern [[Northern Frostlands]] in the [[Mortal Plane]]. [[Category:Fey]] [[Category:Notable People]]

Also called "moon-thistle silk" or "fey silk", this fabric is notably only created with the involvement of the [[fey]]. Woven from the fibers of a rare plant and infused with fey-aspected aether, it is only ever seen on mortals as a gift. A given garment is created for an individual--to that person, it is smooth and strong, nearly steel-strength. To anyone else, it would be like wearing thistles (hence the "thistle" part of the name). The "moon" part comes because it shimmers like moonlight on water, It cannot be dyed, but its construction forms patterns based on the recipient's soul as well as the creator's nature. Each garment is completely individual. [[Category:Special Materials]]

revision.comment: Created page with "An arch-[[comiedai]], one of the most powerful of his kind. But also one of the more cautious. He has taken up residence near the [[Drowned Coast]] along with several others o..."
revision.text: An arch-[[comiedai]], one of the most powerful of his kind. But also one of the more cautious. He has taken up residence near the [[Drowned Coast]] along with several others of his kind. A renegade, he rejects both [[Leviathan]] and the [[Twisted]]'s influence, choosing to forge his own path toward the "perfection" of mortal society...at least as he sees it. His are the mental tentacles behind the [[Tlalocana]] empire. [[Category:Notable People]] [[Category:Noefra]]

revision.comment: Admiralbenbo moved page [[Storm, Moon, Sun, and Leaf]] to [[Ruin Raiders]]: Official Name change
revision.text:
'''WARNING: Provisional name.'''
A party adventuring in the [[Fiach Wood]] and surrounding areas, starting early 253 AC (2024 AD).
== People ==
* [[Tyra Blackstone]] * [[Asher Frye]] * [[Goban tighe Gro'Roc]] * [[Flynn Gro'Arborg]]
== Adventures ==
# Escorting group investigating the ruins of [[Markal]], a pre-cataclysm city. ## Start in [[Duleog]] NE of [[Baile Duchas]]. Travel to Markal. ## Dealt with wolves threatening the camp. ## Clearing undead out of crypt. Discovered door locked by "relics" ## Looked for relics in the keep. Found record of invasion/fall. ## Negotiated with Rebecca, a were-rat primalist living under temple with her family (more rats). Negotiated with Thaddeus, an awakened giant rat, and acquired crown. ## Returned to crypt, fought through remaining undead. Acquired a piece of the map to the [[Taurishen]]. ## Scouts reported that there was a hostile force of orcs en route, seemingly looking for the camp/map. # Returned to [[Duleog]] looking for more info on the Taurishen. ## Met with zoo-keeper, saved his butt. Found out about rogue orc ([[Diedre Mar'osh]]). ## Discovered that there were at least 3 more pieces--2 to the NE and one to the NW. ## Returned to [[Duleog]], discovered people watching them. Intimidated a baker, who was saved from actual harm by having a kid. # Set out NW in search of another map piece. ## Struggled crossing a river during a storm. ## Met [[Segi no Iusta]] ## Fought Orthos Mad-eye (an insane ogre mage) and his patron Ose the Flubbering. ## Recovered map piece. # Hastened back to [[Duleog]] after hearing that the camp had been attacked and some of the people taken prisoner by the orcs. Placed map piece in lead case to avoid location. # Headed SE to forests edge. Cleaned out manticore pair. # Found [[Scaeva Tower]], dealt with [[EsJay vo'Gal]]. Interrupted automaton delivery to [[Mar'osh]]. # Headed to Red Lake, met smugglers from [[Rauviz City]] delivering goods to [[Mar'osh]]. Hitched ride north. Goban broke a girl's heart, got beaten by her adoptive father. # In [[Mar'osh]], ##met with some outlaws, detoured east, discovered that [[Diedre Mar'osh]] was trying to frame them for killing a village, defeated that attempt. ## Headed to the capital, nearly got robbed, met with king. revision.text:
A young black [[Dragons|dragon]] active in the NW portion of the [[Fiach Wood]], on the fringes of [[Wyrmhold]] territory.
== Hoard == His hoard is fairly standard for a dragon. Gold, silver, shiny treasures of all types.
This causes him a fair amount of discomfort given his personality.
== Personality == Segi is a firm believer in Justice and the need for heroes. And ''desperately'' wants to be seen as a Hero of Justice himself. He hates slavery more than anything, in part due to his personal history (see below). His sense of justice is very personal--it's about people hurting other people. Details about who owns what property is much less important, although part of that is cope at his (hoard-driven) need to gather treasures himself, leading him to overlook things like the source of that wealth, as long as he earned it for services rendered. He does not raid or tax people, but he does offer to do jobs (preferably ones that involve him being a hero).
He is very besotted with adventurers, holding them (irrationally) out as exemplars of what he wants to become.
== History == Segi has an odd history. His egg was laid before the [[War of Souls]] and stolen from the nest (in part due to [[Gozh]]'s young mistake) and taken to [[Imperial Research Alpha]] right before the beginning of the war. He spent the instantaneous millennium during the [[Concept bomb]]-induced temporal disruption in the egg. He was hatched when [[Corran Scalebender]] took control in ~200 AC. [[Category:Dragons]]

'''Age''': 22
'''Height''': 5’2
'''Pronoun''': She/her (female)
'''Lineage''': [[Tieflings|Tiefling]]
== Backstory == Tyra’s memories are fragmented in that she has very little memories before she went to [[Crisial City|Crisial]]. From what she remembers, her mother was very ill and she lived in a convent. At some point, she was given to her father. She doesn’t exactly recall what happened when she stayed with her father, other than him leaving her on the streets of Crisial. From what she briefly remembers, she kept begging dad not to go/leave her.
From then on, she was picked up by an older boy named Jasper Blackstone. Jasper and Tyra stuck around together, where the two were part of some kind of gang in Crisial. After some time, due to an incident on a job, Tyra got into trouble and had to leave Jasper. She has no idea what happened to him.
After traveling, she arrived at [[Rauviz City|Rauviz]] and ran out of gold. She tried to rob [[Asher Frye|Asher]], who caught her fairly easily and she learned that they shared the same mark. With that discovery and realizing they are half-siblings, she started sticking with him and helping until they traveled together.
Her goal is to find dad and also what happened to Jasper. Tyra also uses Jasper’s last name as she has no idea what her own was, due to memory issues. Also she isn’t sure if mom is alive or dead. [[Category:Adventurers]]

'''Age''': 25
'''Height''': 6 ft
'''Gender''': male
'''Lineage''': [[Plane-touched|Astral plane-touched]]
== Backstory == Born and raised in the slums of [[Rauviz City|Rauviz]], he never knew who his father was except for the stories his mother would tell. From a young age he was different, stronger than most his age and had a bit of a temper. Out of necessity he fell in with the local gang, The Rats, and became some of their best muscle and one of the “leaders.” One day when he was 16, he was caught out in a bad storm and got struck by lightning. He nearly died but heard a rumbling voice that gave him a second chance. This was also the moment his heritage truly woke up, his appearance becoming what it is today and supercharging his body with lightning. Over the next several years, he gained a reputation and the name “Stormbringer.” This caught the attention of the Riverside Shadows who recruited him to their ranks in exchange for keeping his mother safe and cared for. He worked for them for a while until a fateful day when a woman tried to steal from him. He quickly noticed this woman had a similar mark to him and learned she was his sister. After getting to know each other a bit, they decided to travel together to find out what they can about where they're from.
== Personality == Asher is both very simple and quite complicated. He seems like just some street thug but is sharper than people would think at first glance. Though he is still very much a street thug and product of his environment. He is a very charismatic person much to the surprise of many.
Bonds: His mother and Tyra are the only things in the world that really matter to him. He's also very good on his word. Always doing the job he's paid to do by whoever his employer happens to be. Has a love of storms as well.
Ideals: Mostly just wants to keep his mother and Tyra safe. He would also really love to find dear old dad and totally just ask him questions(definitely not punching him in the groin and face. No way).
Flaws: Has a very reckless and violent streak if his temper is truly tested. He is also quite the haggler and very frugal and greedy, both from growing up poor and in a merchant town. [[Category:Adventurers]]

revision.text:
Said to be a magically-hidden vault, built by the [[Aelvar]] but repurposed by [[Tibor Imperia]] to house "weapons that should not be used lightly". Its exact contents are unknown other than a few names, but everything in there is said to be a proverbial double-edged sword, as dangerous to the wielder as to the enemy.
The name is related to some common roots in both [[Yonwach]] and orcish, meaning "forbidden" or "taboo" or "danger".
== Access == Access to the Taurishen is difficult. It requires assembling four pieces of a magical map as well as acquiring an amulet of passage. The map reveals the location; the amulet grants access. But even if you know where it is, the map is necessary. Some theorize that it actually exists in a demiplane.
The map splits into pieces, but the pieces can be used to locate each other and the amulet. During the post-[[War of Souls]] era, the pieces were kept in separate kingdoms; their locations were lost (along with most knowledge of the Taurishen itself) during the [[Cataclysm War]].
== Contents == Not much is known. Some names:
* Hordebreaker, said to be a longbow capable of slaying armies.

The largest, most politically-influential druid circle on the [[Noefra|Noefran]] continent. Located in the southern [[Byssian Highlands]], this circle's archdruid Damon Dreamcat is one of the three people who act as the nation's executive committee. The circle boasts nearly 200 full druids, mostly scattered throughout the land.
Politically, they are strongly opposed to industrialization and grudgingly work with the local farmers to reduce the impact of necessary agriculture on the surrounding wilds, in exchange for accepting lower growth and a more rural, less "modern" lifestyle with lower-tech implements.
The [[Circle of Purging Flame]]'s "pacifist" branch has official representation in the highest reaches of the Circle. [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Byssia]]

revision.comment: /* Skill Tricks */
revision.text:
'''WARNING: IN-PROGRESS HOMEBREW''' This has not been fully standardized yet. It is not formally in use. = Skill Tricks = Those who are particularly adept at certain aspects of adventuring often learn ways to use their talents to perform tricks that seem supernatural or magical to outside observers. While they are not magical in the same sense as spells or invocations, per se, they do produce effects not normally possible. Each skill trick detailed below shares some common characteristics: * '''An ability score'''. Every skill trick is tied to a particular ability score. That ability score sets its DC. * '''A prerequisite'''. All skill tricks require a certain character level to learn (including levels in all classes if multiclassed). This is waived for classes that grant special access to skill tricks (see Special Class Features below). **'''Proficient Tricks''': Those linked to a particular proficiency require at minimum proficiency in the listed area. If multiple are listed as ''skill OR skill'', you only need proficiency in one of those skills, tools or other sources to qualify. **'''General Tricks''': Those not linked to a particular proficiency are listed as ''(General)''. Qualifying for these tricks require at least a +2 modifier (ability score of 14+) in the listed area. This increases to a +3 modifier for Expert and Master general tricks. No particular proficiency is required. * '''A target or targets'''. Many skill tricks target either an object or one or more creatures. A few target a particular area. * '''An effect'''. The text of the skill trick describes the effect, as well as any saving throws required. === Skill Trick Pool === Many skill tricks have wording that requires you to expend a use of your "skill trick pool". When you take your first skill trick, you gain a pool of uses for all your skill tricks. The maximum number of uses in this pool is equal to your proficiency bonus and expended uses are restored when you finish a long or short rest. === Skill Trick DCs === The DC for any saving throws required by skill tricks is given by
'''8 + the relevant ability score + your proficiency bonus'''
regardless of whether the trick involves a proficiency or not. If you have expertise in the relevant skill or tool, targets have disadvantage on the saving throw. === Acquiring Skill Tricks === Some classes get native access to Skill Tricks as a class feature. If they grant access to more advanced skill tricks beyond the basic ones at particular levels, that access overrides any level-based prerequisites in the skill trick. Everyone else can choose a skill trick that they qualify for whenever they acquire an Ability Score Improvement from their class. At the same time, they can trade out one skill trick they've learned for a different one they qualify for. If you replace a skill trick that grants access to a spell (such as Arcane Initiate) and do not have access to it in another way, you can no longer cast that spell. ====Special Class Features==== * At 10th level when a Fighter can pick a skill trick as part of the ASI, he or she can take an Expert skill trick whose ability is Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution as long as they have proficiency in the appropriate skill (if any), despite not meeting the level/proficiency requirements. * Rogues gain a bonus Basic skill trick at level 1, a bonus Advanced skill trick at level 6 and a bonus Expert skill trick at level 10 that they would otherwise qualify for. Characters that multiclass into rogue after first level do not gain the bonus Basic skill trick. * Bards gain a bonus Basic skill trick at level 2 and a bonus Advanced skill trick at level 7 as long as its ability score is Charisma, Intelligence, or Dexterity. == Basic Skill Tricks == Basic skill tricks require level 4 characters. === Alert ===
''Wisdom (Perception OR Insight) Basic Skill Trick''
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks against being surprised as well as passive Wisdom (Insight). === Arcane Initiate ===
''Intelligence (Arcana) Basic Skill Trick''
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Wizard or Sorcerer list, as well as one spell of 1st level from that same list. You can cast this spell once without spending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your casting ability for these spells. You can pick this skill trick more than once. Each time you do, pick a different cantrip and spell. === Charge ===
''Strength (Martial Weapon) Basic Skill Trick''
When you move at least 15 feet toward an enemy and hit them with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to either make a shove attack against them as part of that attack or deal one extra weapon die of damage against them. === Coordinated Strike ===
''Charisma (Martial Weapon) Basic Skill Trick''
As a bonus action you take when you take the Attack action and attack a target, can expend one use of your skill trick pool. Another creature of your choice that can hear you can use their reaction to make a weapon attack against that same target. If they hit, they deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus. === Craft Apprentice ===
''Crafting Tool (any) Basic Skill Trick''
You can make 8 hours of progress per 24 hour period with your chosen crafting skill while on the road as long as you complete a long rest during that period and do not travel more than 8-ish hours in a day. For every additional hour you travel, reduce the amount of progress by one hour. You learn the schema for one common magic item that requires that proficiency of your choice. === Diplomat ===
''Charisma (Persuasion) Basic Skill Trick''
When you attempt to persuade someone to bypass procedures or to stop hostilities, you always interact as if the opponent is at worst indifferent to you. === Disarm ===
''Strength (Martial Weapon) Basic Skill Trick''
When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to attempt to disarm the opponent. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, their wielded weapon falls at their feet. If they are at least two sizes larger than you, they make the save at advantage. If they are one size or more smaller than you, they do so at disadvantage. === Divine Initiate ===
''Wisdom (Religion) Basic Skill Trick''
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Cleric list, as well as one spell of 1st level from that same list. You can cast this spell once without spending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your casting ability for these spells. You can pick this skill trick more than once. Each time you do, pick a different cantrip and spell. === Evasive Footwork ===
''Dexterity (General) Basic Skill Trick''
When you would be hit by an attack, you can use your reaction and expend one use of your skill trick pool to increase your Armor Class against that attack by your proficiency bonus, potentially causing the attack to miss. === Feint ===
''Charisma (Deception) Basic Skill Trick''
You can expend one use of your skill trick pool to fake an attack as a bonus action, trying to misdirect the enemy. The opponent must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you have advantage on your next attack roll against them. On a successful save, you do not expend the use of the trick, but cannot use it against that same target for one hour. === Frighten ===
''Charisma (Intimidation) Basic Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to threaten one enemy that can hear you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are frightened of you until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, you do not expend the use of the trick, but cannot use it against that same target for one hour. === Haggler ===
''Charisma (Persuasion OR Deception) Basic Skill Trick''
You are particularly good at haggling. Any time you sell goods, you get 125% of the normal price, and you buy for 90% of the listed price. === Jump ===
''Strength (Athletics) Basic Skill Trick''
You always count as having a running start when jumping. Additionally, you can fall an additional 10 ft. before taking fall damage. Start counting fall damage from 20 ft = 1d6 instead of 10 ft = 1d6. === Linguist ===
''Intelligence (General) Basic Skill Trick''
When you listen to conversation in a language you don't speak for at least 10 minutes, you can pick up the rudiments. Enough to be understood, but not enough to convey subtle details. Additionally, you can make out the basic sense of any text written in a script for which you are fluent in at least one language. This does not help you decipher intentionally obfuscated or encoded messages. === Lung Capacity ===
''Constitution (General) Basic Skill Trick''
You can hold your breath for twice as long. In addition, you can expend one use from your skill trick pool when you are exposed to a source of poison gas (such as ''cloudkill'' or a dretch's Stench ability) that requires a Constitution saving throw to gain advantage on the Constitution saving throw. === Medic ===
''Wisdom (Medicine) Basic Skill Trick''
When you make a Wisdom (Medicine) check to stabilize someone at 0 HP and succeed, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to cause the target to regain 1 hit point and is conscious instead of stable. === Misdirect ===
''Dexterity (Stealth) Basic Skill Trick''
When you are hidden, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to force a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature that fails the saving throw does not notice you even if you move out of heavy obscurement, as long as you end your turn behind heavy obscurement. If all targets succeed on their saving throw, you do not expend the use of the trick, but cannot use it against that same target for one hour. === Piercing Wound ===
''Dexterity (Martial Weapon) Basic Skill Trick''
When you hit with an attack from a ranged weapon or a Finesse weapon, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to try to hamper the offense of the opponent. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, their next weapon attack is at disadvantage. On a successful save, you do not expend the use of the trick, but cannot use it against that same target until the end of their next turn. === Primal Initiate ===
''Wisdom (Nature) Basic Skill Trick''
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Druid or Shaman list, as well as one spell of 1st level. You can cast this spell once without spending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your casting ability for these spells. You can pick this skill trick more than once. Each time you do, pick a different cantrip and spell. === Scholar: History ===
''Intelligence (History) Basic Skill Trick''
You can automatically identify significant family lines, crests, and recent events across the local area. Additionally, when you make an Intelligence (History) check to know information about more obscure facts, you do so at advantage. === Scholar: Nature ===
''Intelligence (Nature) Basic Skill Trick''
You automatically tell the creature type of beings you interact with for at least 10 seconds, as long as it is not masked by magic. In addition, when you make an Intelligence (Nature) check to recall information about habitats, patterns of life, or behaviors of natural or semi-natural creatures, you do so at advantage. === Scholar: Religion ===
''Intelligence (Religion) Basic Skill Trick''
You automatically recognize holy symbols of currently-active religions and know at least the basic tenants of that religion. Additionally, when you make an Intelligence (Religion) check to know information about dead or obscure religions or their worshippers, you have advantage on the check. === Sense Baleful Magic ===
''Wisdom (Arcana) Basic Skill Trick''
You are sensitive to the presence of hostile magics in your proximity. When you are within 30 ft. of a magical trap, spell glyph, or other hostile magical environment, you can use your passive Wisdom (Arcana) instead of your passive Wisdom (Perception) to determine their location and nature. Additionally, you have advantage on checks made to determine the spell being cast. === Shield Bash ===
''Strength (Shield) Basic Skill Trick. Requires a wielded shield.''
You can expend one use of your skill trick pool to lash out with your shield. Make an attack with a proficient melee weapon. On a hit, the opponent takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage and is staggered until the end of their next turn. If you score a critical hit, the target is staggered until the end of your next turn. This can replace an attack when you take the Attack action. Staggered creatures make attacks at disadvantage, cannot take reactions or cast non-cantrip spells, and have disadvantage on Dexterity and Strength saving throws. === Soothe Domesticated Animal ===
''Wisdom (Animal Handling) Basic Skill Trick''
You can make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check against a DC of 10 to alter the disposition of a domesticated animal to friendly toward you or prevent a domesticated animal from panicking. Trained guard animals have a DC of 15 if they were hostile toward you. This effect lasts for one hour unless you or your allies attack the animals or their friends. === Trap Finder ===
''Intelligence (Investigation) Basic Skill Trick''
You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to find trap triggers or figure out how to disable them. In addition, you can expend a use of your skill trick pool to gain advantage on any Dexterity saving throws to avoid their effects. === Tumble ===
''Dexterity (Acrobatics) Basic Skill Trick''
You can move through opponents' spaces if they are one size larger than you. They count as difficult terrain and you cannot willingly end your movement in their space. == Advanced Skill Tricks == Advanced skill tricks require level 8 characters. === Arcane Journeyman ===
''Intelligence (Arcana) Advanced Skill Trick''
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Wizard or Sorcerer list, as well as one spell of 1st or 2nd level from the same list. You can cast this spell once without spending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your casting ability for these spells. You can pick this skill trick more than once. Each time you do, pick a different cantrip and spell. === Athlete ===
''Strength (Athletics) Advanced Skill Trick''
You can climb at full speed without making checks even on surfaces with few handholds or slick surfaces. You can expend a use of your skill trick pool to climb even magically slick surfaces without needing hands or a check; if you are still on this surface at the start of your next turn, you must expend additional uses or use your hands. Additionally, you gain a swimming speed equal to your normal speed and no longer need to make checks to swim even in very rough or fast waters. Additionally, the distance you can jump doubles and the height at which you start taking fall damage increases to 30 ft (taking 1d6 for the first 30 ft you fall and 1d6 for every 10 ft above that). === Bait and Switch === ''Charisma (Deception) Advanced Skill Trick'' As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to swap places with one willing creature within 5 feet of you. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. === Befriend Wild Animal ===
''Wisdom (Animal Handling) Advanced Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to attempt to soothe an angry beast or monstrosity or befriend a wary beast or monstrosity within 30 feet of you. The target must not speak any language to be a valid target. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw, at advantage if it is actively hostile to you. On a failure, the creature becomes friendly. Originally non-hostile creatures may follow you and protect you as long as you feed them and do not harm them, although they are still wild animals and they are not under your control. === Bond Breaker ===
''Strength (General) Advanced Skill Trick''
You can break any non-magical shackles or bonds without a check by expending a use of your skill trick pool. If the shackles are magical, you gain +10 on the Strength check to break free. === Delay Unconsciousness ===
''Constitution (General) Advanced Skill Trick''
As a reaction when you are brought to zero hit points, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to gain a level of exhaustion. If you do, you do not gain the unconscious condition and can act normally. You still make death saving throws as normal, including when you take damage. If you are still at 0 HP at the end of your next turn, you go unconscious at that point. === Demoralize ===
''Charisma (Intimidation) Advanced Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to either threaten a single enemy that can hear and see you or a group. Targets must make a Wisdom saving throw. If you threaten a single enemy, it suffers the consequences of failing a morale check and is broken until the end of their next turn on a failed save and is then frightened of you for one minute. If you threaten a group of creature, any that fail their saving throw are frightened of you for one minute. Frightened creatures can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. Broken creatures attempt to exit combat by fleeing, surrendering, or playing dead. They take no actions other than in service of this goal. === Divine Journeyman ===
''Wisdom (Religion) Advanced Skill Trick''
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Cleric list, as well as one spell of 1st or 2nd level from the same list. You can cast this spell once without spending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your casting ability for these spells. You can pick this skill trick more than once. Each time you do, pick a different cantrip and spell. === Fascinate ===
''Charisma (Performance) Advanced Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to begin a distracting performance. Any number of creatures of your choice within 60 ft of you that can hear and see you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they can't focus on anything but you and are effectively blinded and deafened to all other occurrences. If a target takes any damage or is shaken awake by someone else as an action, the effect ends for that creature. This effect lasts until you stop performing (using your action each round to maintain the distraction). === Find Weakness ===
''Intelligence (Investigation) Advanced Skill Trick''
As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to search for flaws in your opponent. Make an Intelligence (Investigation) check against a DC of 10 + half the target's CR. On a success, you learn three of the following of your choice. * Their highest and lowest saving throw modifiers * Any resistances or immunities they have. * Any vulnerabilities they have (whether of a particular damage type or things like Sunlight Sensitivity) * Their current goals Alternatively on a success, you can temporarily remove any one damage resistance you know about by informing your allies how to bypass it. This lasts for one minute. === Mental Toughness ===
''Charisma (General) Advanced Skill Trick''
When you are afflicted by the charmed, frightened, or incapacitated conditions at the beginning of your turn due to an effect that caused a Wisdom saving throw, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to to ignore the effects of those conditions until the end of your turn. === People Whisperer ===
''Wisdom (Insight) Advanced Skill Trick''
When you make a Wisdom (Insight) check and the result is above a 15, you gain one pertinent, specific detail about the target's mental or emotional state for every 5 higher you rolled (ie 1 at 15, 2 at 20, etc.). === Primal Journeyman ===
''Wisdom (Religion) Advanced Skill Trick''
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Druid or Shaman list, as well as one spell of 1st or 2nd level from the same list. Wisdom is your casting ability for these spells. You can pick this skill trick more than once. Each time you do, pick a different cantrip and spell. === Pocket Sand ===
''Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) Advanced Skill Trick''
As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your skill trick pool to attempt to throw sand or dust into an opponent's eyes. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they are blinded until the end of your next turn. This does not work on targets that don't use eyes to see. On a success, you do not expend the use but cannot use this skill trick on the same target for one hour. === Resuscitation ===
''Wisdom (Medicine) Advanced Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend two uses of your skill trick pool to attempt to resuscitate someone who died within the last minute. Make a Wisdom (Medicine) check against a DC of 15 + the number of rounds since they died. On a success, the creature is restored to 1 HP and any mortal wounds are closed, but gains a permanent injury. Both you and the target gain one level of exhaustion. === Skulker ===
''Dexterity (Stealth) Advanced Skill Trick''
You can attempt to hide even if only lightly obscured. Additionally, missing with an attack does not remove the hidden or invisible status. If you hit with an attack, you can expend a use of your skill trick pool to remain hidden or invisible. === Snow Job ===
''Charisma (Deception) Advanced Skill Trick''
When you make a Charisma (Deception) check to convince someone you know something you don't or are someone you are not, you do so at advantage. In addition, if you succeed by more than 5, the target willingly tells you the missing information. === Sunder ===
''Strength (Carpentry, Mason's, or Blacksmith's Tools) Advanced Skill Trick''
When you make an attack against an unattended object and hit, you ignore its Damage Threshold and deal double damage. Alternatively, you can target attended objects as follows, expending a use of your skill trick pool: * '''Armor''': Make an attack against the wearer's AC. On a hit, the target takes half damage from the attack but any other attacks against the target have advantage until the target uses an action to realign the damaged piece. * '''Weapons''': Make an attack against the wielder's AC. On a hit, the target takes half damage from the attack and has disadvantage on all attacks made with that weapon. * '''Wielded spell foci or other objects in hand''': Make an attack at disadvantage against the holder's AC. On a hit, the focus or object is knocked from their grasp and lands 1d6 × 5 ft away in a random direction. === Wrestler ===
''Strength (Athletics) Advanced Skill Trick''
You can grapple and shove creatures two sizes larger than yourself. If you expend a use of your skill trick pool, you can remove the size limit entirely for this attempt. Additionally, when you start your turn with a creature grappled, you can expend a use of your skill trick pool and attempt a second grapple check. If you succeed, the target is restrained until the grapple ends. == Expert Skill Tricks == Expert skill tricks require level 12 characters. === Blindfighter ===
''Wisdom (Perception) Expert Skill Trick''
Invisible or unseen enemies no longer have advantage to hit you. In addition, you do not have disadvantage to hit invisible or unseen enemies and gain blindsight out to 10 ft. If you already have blindsight or gain it later, this stacks. === Break Will ===
''Charisma (Intimidation) Expert Skill Trick''
This skill trick acts like [[#demoralize|Demoralize]] except that you can force any number of creatures that can see and hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw, becoming broken on a failure and frightened of you on a success. The frightened or broken state lasts for 1 minute. The cost increases to two uses of your skill trick pool. === Comprehend Dweomer ===
''Intelligence (Arcana) Expert Skill Trick''
You gain the following benefits: * You can determine the nature of any arcane phenomena you encounter, including spell glyphs, illusions, etc. * You can detect spellcasting within 60 ft. of you even if there are no components. * You can expend a use of your skill trick pool as a reaction to attempt to disrupt spellcasting by a creature you can see within 60 ft. of you. Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check against a DC of 10 + the spell level. On a success, the spell fails. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you can substitute your spellcasting ability for Intelligence. === Dungeoncrasher ===
''Strength (Athletics) Expert Skill Trick''
When you move at least 10 feet before attempting to shove a creature, you can shove any size of creature. In addition, the distance you can shove creatures increases by 15 feet if you expend a use of your skill trick pool when making the check. If the creature is stopped short of the full distance by a hard surface, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they are stunned until the end of their next turn. If they are stopped by running into a creature of their size or smaller, the other creature is knocked prone unless they succeed on a Strength saving throw. === Find Portal ===
''Wisdom (Survival) Expert Skill Trick''
You search for signs of an accessible planar portal within 1 mile of you. Make a Wisdom (Survival) check and expend two uses of your skill trick pool, with advantage if you also are proficient in Arcana. The result determines your success: {| class="wikitable" |+Find Portal Result Table !Check Total !Result |- |< 10 |You find a portal to a plane of the GM's choosing. The location on that plane that it leads to is immediately dangerous. |- |10-14 |You find a portal to a plane of the GM's choosing. The location on that plane that it leads to is not inherently dangerous. |- |15-19 |You find a portal to a plane of your choosing. The location on that plane that it leads to is chosen by the GM, but is not inherently dangerous. |- |20+ |You find a portal to a plane of your choosing. You can choose the approximate location that it leads to. |} === Like a Ghost ===
''Dexterity (Stealth) Expert Skill Trick''
When you are hidden, you no longer need to be concealed to remain hidden, but you must expend a use of your skill trick pool for every turn you spend hidden without concealment. Missing with an attack no longer breaks stealth, although casting a spell with verbal components or hitting with an attack does reveal your position. === Slippery ===
''Dexterity (Acrobatics) Expert Skill Trick''
You can no longer be grappled or restrained by non-legendary effects as long as you expend a use of your skill trick pool when the effect is applied. == Master Skill Tricks == Master skill tricks require level 16 characters. === Balance on Thin Air ===
''Dexterity (Acrobatics) Master Skill Trick''
You can expend a use of your skill trick pool at the beginning of each of your turns to walk on air as if it was solid ground until the start of your next turn. === Dragon's Fear ===
''Charisma (Intimidation) Master Skill Trick''
This skill trick works as [[#break-will|Break Will]], but with the addition that creatures whose challenge rating is less than half your level automatically fail the saving throw and creatures higher than that have disadvantage on the saving throw. The cost increases to three uses of your skill trick pool. === Friend to All ===
''Charisma (Persuasion) Master Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend two uses of your skill trick pool to magically call for a truce even during combat. All creatures that can understand your language must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they become non-hostile until someone takes a hostile action. This ability does not work on mindless creatures, including zombies and skeletons. Alternatively, if you are not actively fighting someone, you can expend a use of your skill trick pool to force them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, their disposition to you increases by one step for 10 minutes or until you take hostile action against them. Once the effect ends, they will still follow through on any bargains struck during that time (if their nature allows--exceptionally chaotic entities such as demons will act according to their natures), but their disposition toward you may change. === Force Portal ===
''Wisdom (Arcana) Master Skill Trick''
As an action, you can expend two uses of your skill trick pool to force a micro-fissure in the fabric of the planes to form a full-fledged portal that lasts for 6 seconds. You can choose what plane it exits to, but only a rough description of the location on that plane. === Healing Hands ===
''Wisdom (Medicine) Master Skill Trick''
As an action you can expend three uses of your skill trick pool to magically do one of the following to a creature you touch. * Heal the creature to half of its maximum hit points. * Remove any condition from a living creature. * Cure any disease and remove any poison or curse affecting the creature. * Break one spell affecting the creature. * Restore a dead body to life as long as it has been dead less than 1 hour. Taking this benefit causes both you and the target 3 levels of exhaustion. [[Category:Homebrew]]

revision.text:
The Shadows are a criminal gang that controls much of the residential slums of [[Rauviz City]].
== Organization == '''Symbol''': A black scarf, tied around the neck or around an upper arm.
The gang is organized into turfs (geographically-distinct chunks of the city, usually bounded by a larger road). Each turf's enforcers pay homage to a turf-boss, who usually gets that status by being the meanest/toughest goon. The boss generally has a small number (2-3) of lieutenants. Turf wars between bosses are not unknown--the way you rise in the organization is by taking from another boss. More underlings equals more status.
At the top of the gang are the two operational leaders (the Daymaster and Nightmaster, each responsible for half the day) and above them is the Shadowmaster. Books (the quartermaster/treasurer) rounds out the top 4.
=== Daymaster and Nightmaster === The current Daymaster is Arnold Blackhand, a 6'5", 350-lb human (although some would question that) man in his late 20s. Extremely ugly, mostly due to repeated bare-knuckle fights. Known for superior toughness and physical strength and for not taking no guff from nobody.
The current Nightmaster is Jennifer Anna Stone, a 5'2, 100-lb half-elf (sharp-ear) woman in her mid 30s. She would be beautiful...except for the livid scar that runs across the left side of her face. And her nearly-constant giggle, which is said to drive shivers of fear up the spine of the most fearless goon. She loves her knives. Much more intellectual than Arnold, but mostly in the service of causing pain.
=== Books === The treasurer of the Shadows is always called Books, whatever their old name was. The current Books is a pleasant, unassuming dwarven woman in her mid 60s. Not much is known about her past, other than that she abandoned her family and husband some time ago. Only money moves her--she is death on debtors who don't pay up.
=== Shadowmaster === The current Shadowmaster is somewhat of an enigma. A foppish human, native to Rauviz City, Jerold Day-lily never showed much competence in his privileged life. Then suddenly at age 25 he threw away his station in life (or did he?) and started rising through the ranks of the Shadows. He lived a charmed life, avoiding assassination attempts as if warned in advance...but with no display of cunning. He'd just...not be there. Or the knives would miss. Or the killers would turn on each other. And then their paymasters would be found dead in accidents. He ascended to the rank of Shadowmaster about 10 years ago (an eternity in a gang like this) and has generally stayed out of the day-to-day. But his favorites do well and those who oppose him...vanish.
== Operations == The Shadows are primarily a protection racket. They "police" the slums, providing toughs to squash any demonstrations and demand that business pay them "so things don't burn down accidentally." They do light money-lending and facilitate a lot of smuggling, but don't necessarily handle the details themselves. They are known to have heavy ties with landholders and industrial magnates in their territory, and many of the thugs have daylight jobs with Spode or similar. [[Category:Organizations]] [[Category:Rauviz]]
